191 bool CCoinsViewCache::GetCoins(const uint256 &txid, CCoins &coins) {
192  if (cacheCoins.count(txid)) {
193  coins = cacheCoins[txid];
194  return true;
195  }
196  if (base->GetCoins(txid, coins)) {
197  cacheCoins[txid] = coins;
198  return true;
199  }
200  return false;
201 }
202 
203 std::map<uint256,CCoins>::iterator CCoinsViewCache::FetchCoins(const uint256 &txid) {
204  std::map<uint256,CCoins>::iterator it = cacheCoins.lower_bound(txid);
205  if (it != cacheCoins.end() && it->first == txid)
206  return it;
207  CCoins tmp;
208  if (!base->GetCoins(txid,tmp))
209  return cacheCoins.end();
210  std::map<uint256,CCoins>::iterator ret = cacheCoins.insert(it, std::make_pair(txid, CCoins()));
211  tmp.swap(ret->second);
212  return ret;
213 }
214 
215 CCoins &CCoinsViewCache::GetCoins(const uint256 &txid) {
216  std::map<uint256,CCoins>::iterator it = FetchCoins(txid);
217  assert(it != cacheCoins.end());
218  return it->second;
219 }

283 // mapOrphanTransactions

285 
286 bool AddOrphanTx(const CTransaction& tx)
287 {
288  uint256 hash = tx.GetHash();
289  if (mapOrphanTransactions.count(hash))
290  return false;
291 
292  // Ignore big transactions, to avoid a
293  // send-big-orphans memory exhaustion attack. If a peer has a legitimate
294  // large transaction with a missing parent then we assume
295  // it will rebroadcast it later, after the parent transaction(s)
296  // have been mined or received.
297  // 10,000 orphans, each of which is at most 5,000 bytes big is
298  // at most 500 megabytes of orphans:
299  unsigned int sz = tx.GetSerializeSize(SER_NETWORK, CTransaction::CURRENT_VERSION);
300  if (sz > 5000)
301  {
302  printf("ignoring large orphan tx (size: %u, hash: %s)\n", sz, hash.ToString().c_str());
303  return false;
304  }
305 
306  mapOrphanTransactions[hash] = tx;
307  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxIn& txin, tx.vin)
308  mapOrphanTransactionsByPrev[txin.prevout.hash].insert(hash);
309 
310  printf("stored orphan tx %s (mapsz %"PRIszu")\n", hash.ToString().c_str(),
311  mapOrphanTransactions.size());
312  return true;
313 }
314 
315 void static EraseOrphanTx(uint256 hash)
316 {
317  if (!mapOrphanTransactions.count(hash))
318  return;
319  const CTransaction& tx = mapOrphanTransactions[hash];
320  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxIn& txin, tx.vin)
321  {
322  mapOrphanTransactionsByPrev[txin.prevout.hash].erase(hash);
323  if (mapOrphanTransactionsByPrev[txin.prevout.hash].empty())
324  mapOrphanTransactionsByPrev.erase(txin.prevout.hash);
325  }
326  mapOrphanTransactions.erase(hash);
327 }
328 
329 unsigned int LimitOrphanTxSize(unsigned int nMaxOrphans)
330 {
331  unsigned int nEvicted = 0;
332  while (mapOrphanTransactions.size() > nMaxOrphans)
333  {
334  // Evict a random orphan:
335  uint256 randomhash = GetRandHash();
336  map<uint256, CTransaction>::iterator it = mapOrphanTransactions.lower_bound(randomhash);
337  if (it == mapOrphanTransactions.end())
338  it = mapOrphanTransactions.begin();
339  EraseOrphanTx(it->first);
340  ++nEvicted;
341  }
342  return nEvicted;
343 }

363 bool CTransaction::IsStandard(string& strReason) const
364 {
365  if (nVersion > CTransaction::CURRENT_VERSION || nVersion < 1) {
366  strReason = "version";
367  return false;
368  }
369 
370  if (!IsFinal()) {
371  strReason = "not-final";
372  return false;
373  }
374 
375  // Extremely large transactions with lots of inputs can cost the network
376  // almost as much to process as they cost the sender in fees, because
377  // computing signature hashes is O(ninputs*txsize). Limiting transactions
378  // to MAX_STANDARD_TX_SIZE mitigates CPU exhaustion attacks.
379  unsigned int sz = this->GetSerializeSize(SER_NETWORK, CTransaction::CURRENT_VERSION);
380  if (sz >= MAX_STANDARD_TX_SIZE) {
381  strReason = "tx-size";
382  return false;
383  }
384 
385  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxIn& txin, vin)
386  {
387  // Biggest 'standard' txin is a 3-signature 3-of-3 CHECKMULTISIG
388  // pay-to-script-hash, which is 3 ~80-byte signatures, 3
389  // ~65-byte public keys, plus a few script ops.
390  if (txin.scriptSig.size() > 500) {
391  strReason = "scriptsig-size";
392  return false;
393  }
394  if (!txin.scriptSig.IsPushOnly()) {
395  strReason = "scriptsig-not-pushonly";
396  return false;
397  }
398  }
399  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxOut& txout, vout) {
400  if (!::IsStandard(txout.scriptPubKey)) {
401  strReason = "scriptpubkey";
402  return false;
403  }
404  if (txout.IsDust()) {
405  strReason = "dust";
406  return false;
407  }
408  }
409  return true;
410 }
411 
412 //
413 // Check transaction inputs, and make sure any
414 // pay-to-script-hash transactions are evaluating IsStandard scripts
415 //
416 // Why bother? To avoid denial-of-service attacks; an attacker
417 // can submit a standard HASH... OP_EQUAL transaction,
418 // which will get accepted into blocks. The redemption
419 // script can be anything; an attacker could use a very
420 // expensive-to-check-upon-redemption script like:
421 // DUP CHECKSIG DROP ... repeated 100 times... OP_1
422 //
423 bool CTransaction::AreInputsStandard(CCoinsViewCache& mapInputs) const
424 {
425  if (IsCoinBase())
426  return true; // Coinbases don't use vin normally
427 
428  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < vin.size(); i++)
429  {
430  const CTxOut& prev = GetOutputFor(vin[i], mapInputs);
431 
432  vector<vector<unsigned char> > vSolutions;
433  txnouttype whichType;
434  // get the scriptPubKey corresponding to this input:
435  const CScript& prevScript = prev.scriptPubKey;
436  if (!Solver(prevScript, whichType, vSolutions))
437  return false;
438  int nArgsExpected = ScriptSigArgsExpected(whichType, vSolutions);
439  if (nArgsExpected < 0)
440  return false;
441 
442  // Transactions with extra stuff in their scriptSigs are
443  // non-standard. Note that this EvalScript() call will
444  // be quick, because if there are any operations
445  // beside "push data" in the scriptSig the
446  // IsStandard() call returns false
447  vector<vector<unsigned char> > stack;
448  if (!EvalScript(stack, vin[i].scriptSig, *this, i, false, 0))
449  return false;
450 
451  if (whichType == TX_SCRIPTHASH)
452  {
453  if (stack.empty())
454  return false;
455  CScript subscript(stack.back().begin(), stack.back().end());
456  vector<vector<unsigned char> > vSolutions2;
457  txnouttype whichType2;
458  if (!Solver(subscript, whichType2, vSolutions2))
459  return false;
460  if (whichType2 == TX_SCRIPTHASH)
461  return false;
462 
463  int tmpExpected;
464  tmpExpected = ScriptSigArgsExpected(whichType2, vSolutions2);
465  if (tmpExpected < 0)
466  return false;
467  nArgsExpected += tmpExpected;
468  }
469 
470  if (stack.size() != (unsigned int)nArgsExpected)
471  return false;
472  }
473 
474  return true;
475 }

492 int CMerkleTx::SetMerkleBranch(const CBlock* pblock)
493 {
494  CBlock blockTmp;
495 
496  if (pblock == NULL) {
497  CCoins coins;
498  if (pcoinsTip->GetCoins(GetHash(), coins)) {
499  CBlockIndex *pindex = FindBlockByHeight(coins.nHeight);
500  if (pindex) {
501  if (!blockTmp.ReadFromDisk(pindex))
502  return 0;
503  pblock = &blockTmp;
504  }
505  }
506  }
507 
508  if (pblock) {
509  // Update the tx's hashBlock
510  hashBlock = pblock->GetHash();
511 
512  // Locate the transaction
513  for (nIndex = 0; nIndex < (int)pblock->vtx.size(); nIndex++)
514  if (pblock->vtx[nIndex] == *(CTransaction*)this)
515  break;
516  if (nIndex == (int)pblock->vtx.size())
517  {
518  vMerkleBranch.clear();
519  nIndex = -1;
520  printf("ERROR: SetMerkleBranch() : couldn't find tx in block\n");
521  return 0;
522  }
523 
524  // Fill in merkle branch
525  vMerkleBranch = pblock->GetMerkleBranch(nIndex);
526  }
527 
528  // Is the tx in a block that's in the main chain
529  map<uint256, CBlockIndex*>::iterator mi = mapBlockIndex.find(hashBlock);
530  if (mi == mapBlockIndex.end())
531  return 0;
532  CBlockIndex* pindex = (*mi).second;
533  if (!pindex || !pindex->IsInMainChain())
534  return 0;
535 
536  return pindexBest->nHeight - pindex->nHeight + 1;
537 }

545 bool CTransaction::CheckTransaction(CValidationState &state) const
546 {
547  // Basic checks that don't depend on any context
548  if (vin.empty())
549  return state.DoS(10, error("CTransaction::CheckTransaction() : vin empty"));
550  if (vout.empty())
551  return state.DoS(10, error("CTransaction::CheckTransaction() : vout empty"));
552  // Size limits
553  if (::GetSerializeSize(*this, SER_NETWORK, PROTOCOL_VERSION) > MAX_BLOCK_SIZE)
554  return state.DoS(100, error("CTransaction::CheckTransaction() : size limits failed"));
555 
556  // Check for negative or overflow output values
557  int64 nValueOut = 0;
558  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxOut& txout, vout)
559  {
560  if (txout.nValue < 0)
561  return state.DoS(100, error("CTransaction::CheckTransaction() : txout.nValue negative"));
562  if (txout.nValue > MAX_MONEY)
563  return state.DoS(100, error("CTransaction::CheckTransaction() : txout.nValue too high"));
564  nValueOut += txout.nValue;
565  if (!MoneyRange(nValueOut))
566  return state.DoS(100, error("CTransaction::CheckTransaction() : txout total out of range"));
567  }
568 
569  // Check for duplicate inputs
570  set<COutPoint> vInOutPoints;
571  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxIn& txin, vin)
572  {
573  if (vInOutPoints.count(txin.prevout))
574  return state.DoS(100, error("CTransaction::CheckTransaction() : duplicate inputs"));
575  vInOutPoints.insert(txin.prevout);
576  }
577 
578  if (IsCoinBase())
579  {
580  if (vin[0].scriptSig.size() < 2 || vin[0].scriptSig.size() > 100)
581  return state.DoS(100, error("CTransaction::CheckTransaction() : coinbase script size"));
582  }
583  else
584  {
585  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxIn& txin, vin)
586  if (txin.prevout.IsNull())
587  return state.DoS(10, error("CTransaction::CheckTransaction() : prevout is null"));
588  }
589 
590  return true;
591 }
592 
593 int64 CTransaction::GetMinFee(unsigned int nBlockSize, bool fAllowFree,
594  enum GetMinFee_mode mode) const
595 {
596  // Base fee is either nMinTxFee or nMinRelayTxFee
597  int64 nBaseFee = (mode == GMF_RELAY) ? nMinRelayTxFee : nMinTxFee;
598 
599  unsigned int nBytes = ::GetSerializeSize(*this, SER_NETWORK, PROTOCOL_VERSION);
600  unsigned int nNewBlockSize = nBlockSize + nBytes;
601  int64 nMinFee = (1 + (int64)nBytes / 1000) * nBaseFee;
602 
603  if (fAllowFree)
604  {
605  // There is a free transaction area in blocks created by most miners,
606  // * If we are relaying we allow transactions up to DEFAULT_BLOCK_PRIORITY_SIZE - 1000
607  // to be considered to fall into this category. We don't want to encourage sending
608  // multiple transactions instead of one big transaction to avoid fees.
609  // * If we are creating a transaction we allow transactions up to 5,000 bytes
610  // to be considered safe and assume they can likely make it into this section.
611  if (nBytes < (mode == GMF_SEND ? 5000 : (DEFAULT_BLOCK_PRIORITY_SIZE - 1000)))
612  nMinFee = 0;
613  }
614 
615  // Czarcoin
616  // To limit dust spam, add nBaseFee for each output less than DUST_SOFT_LIMIT
617  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxOut& txout, vout)
618  if (txout.nValue < DUST_SOFT_LIMIT)
619  nMinFee += nBaseFee;
620 
621  // Raise the price as the block approaches full
622  if (nBlockSize != 1 && nNewBlockSize >= MAX_BLOCK_SIZE_GEN/2)
623  {
624  if (nNewBlockSize >= MAX_BLOCK_SIZE_GEN)
625  return MAX_MONEY;
626  nMinFee *= MAX_BLOCK_SIZE_GEN / (MAX_BLOCK_SIZE_GEN - nNewBlockSize);
627  }
628 
629  if (!MoneyRange(nMinFee))
630  nMinFee = MAX_MONEY;
631  return nMinFee;
632 }
633 
634 void CTxMemPool::pruneSpent(const uint256 &hashTx, CCoins &coins)
635 {
636  LOCK(cs);
637 
638  std::map<COutPoint, CInPoint>::iterator it = mapNextTx.lower_bound(COutPoint(hashTx, 0));
639 
640  // iterate over all COutPoints in mapNextTx whose hash equals the provided hashTx
641  while (it != mapNextTx.end() && it->first.hash == hashTx) {
642  coins.Spend(it->first.n); // and remove those outputs from coins
643  it++;
644  }
645 }
646 
647 bool CTxMemPool::accept(CValidationState &state, CTransaction &tx, bool fCheckInputs, bool fLimitFree,
648  bool* pfMissingInputs)
649 {
650  if (pfMissingInputs)
651  *pfMissingInputs = false;
652 
653  if (!tx.CheckTransaction(state))
654  return error("CTxMemPool::accept() : CheckTransaction failed");
655 
656  // Coinbase is only valid in a block, not as a loose transaction
657  if (tx.IsCoinBase())
658  return state.DoS(100, error("CTxMemPool::accept() : coinbase as individual tx"));
659 
660  // To help v0.1.5 clients who would see it as a negative number
661  if ((int64)tx.nLockTime > std::numeric_limits<int>::max())
662  return error("CTxMemPool::accept() : not accepting nLockTime beyond 2038 yet");
663 
664  // Rather not work on nonstandard transactions (unless -testnet)
665  string strNonStd;
666  if (!fTestNet && !tx.IsStandard(strNonStd))
667  return error("CTxMemPool::accept() : nonstandard transaction (%s)",
668  strNonStd.c_str());
669 
670  // is it already in the memory pool?
671  uint256 hash = tx.GetHash();
672  {
673  LOCK(cs);
674  if (mapTx.count(hash))
675  return false;
676  }
677 
678  // Check for conflicts with in-memory transactions
679  CTransaction* ptxOld = NULL;
680  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < tx.vin.size(); i++)
681  {
682  COutPoint outpoint = tx.vin[i].prevout;
683  if (mapNextTx.count(outpoint))
684  {
685  // Disable replacement feature for now
686  return false;
687 
688  // Allow replacing with a newer version of the same transaction
689  if (i != 0)
690  return false;
691  ptxOld = mapNextTx[outpoint].ptx;
692  if (ptxOld->IsFinal())
693  return false;
694  if (!tx.IsNewerThan(*ptxOld))
695  return false;
696  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < tx.vin.size(); i++)
697  {
698  COutPoint outpoint = tx.vin[i].prevout;
699  if (!mapNextTx.count(outpoint) || mapNextTx[outpoint].ptx != ptxOld)
700  return false;
701  }
702  break;
703  }
704  }
705 
706  if (fCheckInputs)
707  {
708  CCoinsView dummy;
709  CCoinsViewCache view(dummy);
710 
711  {
712  LOCK(cs);
713  CCoinsViewMemPool viewMemPool(*pcoinsTip, *this);
714  view.SetBackend(viewMemPool);
715 
716  // do we already have it?
717  if (view.HaveCoins(hash))
718  return false;
719 
720  // do all inputs exist?
721  // Note that this does not check for the presence of actual outputs (see the next check for that),
722  // only helps filling in pfMissingInputs (to determine missing vs spent).
723  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxIn txin, tx.vin) {
724  if (!view.HaveCoins(txin.prevout.hash)) {
725  if (pfMissingInputs)
726  *pfMissingInputs = true;
727  return false;
728  }
729  }
730 
731  // are the actual inputs available?
732  if (!tx.HaveInputs(view))
733  return state.Invalid(error("CTxMemPool::accept() : inputs already spent"));
734 
735  // Bring the best block into scope
736  view.GetBestBlock();
737 
738  // we have all inputs cached now, so switch back to dummy, so we don't need to keep lock on mempool
739  view.SetBackend(dummy);
740  }
741 
742  // Check for non-standard pay-to-script-hash in inputs
743  if (!tx.AreInputsStandard(view) && !fTestNet)
744  return error("CTxMemPool::accept() : nonstandard transaction input");
745 
746  // Note: if you modify this code to accept non-standard transactions, then
747  // you should add code here to check that the transaction does a
748  // reasonable number of ECDSA signature verifications.
749 
750  int64 nFees = tx.GetValueIn(view)-tx.GetValueOut();
751  unsigned int nSize = ::GetSerializeSize(tx, SER_NETWORK, PROTOCOL_VERSION);
752 
753  // Don't accept it if it can't get into a block
754  int64 txMinFee = tx.GetMinFee(1000, true, GMF_RELAY);
755  if (fLimitFree && nFees < txMinFee)
756  return error("CTxMemPool::accept() : not enough fees %s, %"PRI64d" < %"PRI64d,
757  hash.ToString().c_str(),
758  nFees, txMinFee);
759 
760  // Continuously rate-limit free transactions
761  // This mitigates 'penny-flooding' -- sending thousands of free transactions just to
762  // be annoying or make others' transactions take longer to confirm.
763  if (fLimitFree && nFees < CTransaction::nMinRelayTxFee)
764  {
765  static double dFreeCount;
766  static int64 nLastTime;
767  int64 nNow = GetTime();
768 
769  LOCK(cs);
770 
771  // Use an exponentially decaying ~10-minute window:
772  dFreeCount *= pow(1.0 - 1.0/600.0, (double)(nNow - nLastTime));
773  nLastTime = nNow;
774  // -limitfreerelay unit is thousand-bytes-per-minute
775  // At default rate it would take over a month to fill 1GB
776  if (dFreeCount >= GetArg("-limitfreerelay", 15)*10*1000)
777  return error("CTxMemPool::accept() : free transaction rejected by rate limiter");
778  if (fDebug)
779  printf("Rate limit dFreeCount: %g => %g\n", dFreeCount, dFreeCount+nSize);
780  dFreeCount += nSize;
781  }
782 
783  // Check against previous transactions
784  // This is done last to help prevent CPU exhaustion denial-of-service attacks.
785  if (!tx.CheckInputs(state, view, true, SCRIPT_VERIFY_P2SH | SCRIPT_VERIFY_STRICTENC))
786  {
787  return error("CTxMemPool::accept() : ConnectInputs failed %s", hash.ToString().c_str());
788  }
789  }
790 
791  // Store transaction in memory
792  {
793  LOCK(cs);
794  if (ptxOld)
795  {
796  printf("CTxMemPool::accept() : replacing tx %s with new version\n", ptxOld->GetHash().ToString().c_str());
797  remove(*ptxOld);
798  }
799  addUnchecked(hash, tx);
800  }
801 
803  // If updated, erase old tx from wallet
804  if (ptxOld)
805  EraseFromWallets(ptxOld->GetHash());
806  SyncWithWallets(hash, tx, NULL, true);
807 
808  return true;
809 }
810 
811 bool CTransaction::AcceptToMemoryPool(CValidationState &state, bool fCheckInputs, bool fLimitFree, bool* pfMissingInputs)
812 {
813  try {
814  return mempool.accept(state, *this, fCheckInputs, fLimitFree, pfMissingInputs);
815  } catch(std::runtime_error &e) {
816  return state.Abort(_("System error: ") + e.what());
817  }
818 }
819 
820 bool CTxMemPool::addUnchecked(const uint256& hash, const CTransaction &tx)
821 {
822  // Add to memory pool without checking anything. Don't call this directly,
823  // call CTxMemPool::accept to properly check the transaction first.
824  {
825  mapTx[hash] = tx;
826  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < tx.vin.size(); i++)
827  mapNextTx[tx.vin[i].prevout] = CInPoint(&mapTx[hash], i);
828  nTransactionsUpdated++;
829  }
830  return true;
831 }
832 
833 
834 bool CTxMemPool::remove(const CTransaction &tx, bool fRecursive)
835 {
836  // Remove transaction from memory pool
837  {
838  LOCK(cs);
839  uint256 hash = tx.GetHash();
840  if (fRecursive) {
841  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < tx.vout.size(); i++) {
842  std::map<COutPoint, CInPoint>::iterator it = mapNextTx.find(COutPoint(hash, i));
843  if (it != mapNextTx.end())
844  remove(*it->second.ptx, true);
845  }
846  }
847  if (mapTx.count(hash))
848  {
849  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxIn& txin, tx.vin)
850  mapNextTx.erase(txin.prevout);
851  mapTx.erase(hash);
852  nTransactionsUpdated++;
853  }
854  }
855  return true;
856 }
857 
858 bool CTxMemPool::removeConflicts(const CTransaction &tx)
859 {
860  // Remove transactions which depend on inputs of tx, recursively
861  LOCK(cs);
862  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxIn &txin, tx.vin) {
863  std::map<COutPoint, CInPoint>::iterator it = mapNextTx.find(txin.prevout);
864  if (it != mapNextTx.end()) {
865  const CTransaction &txConflict = *it->second.ptx;
866  if (txConflict != tx)
867  remove(txConflict, true);
868  }
869  }
870  return true;
871 }
872 
873 void CTxMemPool::clear()
874 {
875  LOCK(cs);
876  mapTx.clear();
877  mapNextTx.clear();
878  ++nTransactionsUpdated;
879 }
880 
881 void CTxMemPool::queryHashes(std::vector<uint256>& vtxid)
882 {
883  vtxid.clear();
884 
885  LOCK(cs);
886  vtxid.reserve(mapTx.size());
887  for (map<uint256, CTransaction>::iterator mi = mapTx.begin(); mi != mapTx.end(); ++mi)
888  vtxid.push_back((*mi).first);
889 }

894 int CMerkleTx::GetDepthInMainChain(CBlockIndex* &pindexRet) const
895 {
896  if (hashBlock == 0 || nIndex == -1)
897  return 0;
898 
899  // Find the block it claims to be in
900  map<uint256, CBlockIndex*>::iterator mi = mapBlockIndex.find(hashBlock);
901  if (mi == mapBlockIndex.end())
902  return 0;
903  CBlockIndex* pindex = (*mi).second;
904  if (!pindex || !pindex->IsInMainChain())
905  return 0;
906 
907  // Make sure the merkle branch connects to this block
908  if (!fMerkleVerified)
909  {
910  if (CBlock::CheckMerkleBranch(GetHash(), vMerkleBranch, nIndex) != pindex->hashMerkleRoot)
911  return 0;
912  fMerkleVerified = true;
913  }
914 
915  pindexRet = pindex;
916  return pindexBest->nHeight - pindex->nHeight + 1;
917 }

936 bool CWalletTx::AcceptWalletTransaction(bool fCheckInputs)
937 {
938  {
939  LOCK(mempool.cs);
940  // Add previous supporting transactions first
941  BOOST_FOREACH(CMerkleTx& tx, vtxPrev)
942  {
943  if (!tx.IsCoinBase())
944  {
945  uint256 hash = tx.GetHash();
946  if (!mempool.exists(hash) && pcoinsTip->HaveCoins(hash))
947  tx.AcceptToMemoryPool(fCheckInputs, false);
948  }
949  }
950  return AcceptToMemoryPool(fCheckInputs, false);
951  }
952  return false;
953 }

955 
956 // Return transaction in tx, and if it was found inside a block, its hash is placed in hashBlock
957 bool GetTransaction(const uint256 &hash, CTransaction &txOut, uint256 &hashBlock, bool fAllowSlow)
958 {
959  CBlockIndex *pindexSlow = NULL;
960  {
961  LOCK(cs_main);
962  {
963  LOCK(mempool.cs);
964  if (mempool.exists(hash))
965  {
966  txOut = mempool.lookup(hash);
967  return true;
968  }
969  }
970 
971  if (fTxIndex) {
972  CDiskTxPos postx;
973  if (pblocktree->ReadTxIndex(hash, postx)) {
974  CAutoFile file(OpenBlockFile(postx, true), SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION);
975  CBlockHeader header;
976  try {
977  file >> header;
978  fseek(file, postx.nTxOffset, SEEK_CUR);
979  file >> txOut;
980  } catch (std::exception &e) {
981  return error("%s() : deserialize or I/O error", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__);
982  }
983  hashBlock = header.GetHash();
984  if (txOut.GetHash() != hash)
985  return error("%s() : txid mismatch", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__);
986  return true;
987  }
988  }
989 
990  if (fAllowSlow) { // use coin database to locate block that contains transaction, and scan it
991  int nHeight = -1;
992  {
993  CCoinsViewCache &view = *pcoinsTip;
994  CCoins coins;
995  if (view.GetCoins(hash, coins))
996  nHeight = coins.nHeight;
997  }
998  if (nHeight > 0)
999  pindexSlow = FindBlockByHeight(nHeight);
1000  }
1001  }
1002 
1003  if (pindexSlow) {
1004  CBlock block;
1005  if (block.ReadFromDisk(pindexSlow)) {
1006  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTransaction &tx, block.vtx) {
1007  if (tx.GetHash() == hash) {
1008  txOut = tx;
1009  hashBlock = pindexSlow->GetBlockHash();
1010  return true;
1011  }
1012  }
1013  }
1014  }
1015 
1016  return false;
1017 }

1021 
1022 
1023 
1025 //
1026 // CBlock and CBlockIndex
1027 //
1028 
1029 static CBlockIndex* pblockindexFBBHLast;
1030 CBlockIndex* FindBlockByHeight(int nHeight)
1031 {
1032  CBlockIndex *pblockindex;
1033  if (nHeight < nBestHeight / 2)
1034  pblockindex = pindexGenesisBlock;
1035  else
1036  pblockindex = pindexBest;
1037  if (pblockindexFBBHLast && abs(nHeight - pblockindex->nHeight) > abs(nHeight - pblockindexFBBHLast->nHeight))
1038  pblockindex = pblockindexFBBHLast;
1039  while (pblockindex->nHeight > nHeight)
1040  pblockindex = pblockindex->pprev;
1041  while (pblockindex->nHeight < nHeight)
1042  pblockindex = pblockindex->pnext;
1043  pblockindexFBBHLast = pblockindex;
1044  return pblockindex;
1045 }

1050  return false;
1051  if (GetHash() != pindex->GetBlockHash())
1052  return error("CBlock::ReadFromDisk() : GetHash() doesn't match index");
1053  return true;
1054 }

1056 uint256 static GetOrphanRoot(const CBlockHeader* pblock)
1057 {

1059  while (mapOrphanBlocks.count(pblock->hashPrevBlock))
1060  pblock = mapOrphanBlocks[pblock->hashPrevBlock];

1064 int64 static GetBlockValue(int nHeight, int64 nFees)
1065 {
1066  int64 nSubsidy = 0 * COIN; // ~100% Premined
1067  if (nHeight == 0){
1068  nSubsidy = 99 * COIN;
1069  } else if (nHeight == 1) {
1070  nSubsidy = 92233720268 * COIN;
1071  }
1072  return nSubsidy + nFees;
1073 }
1074 
1075 // static const int64 nTargetTimespan = 3.5 * 24 * 60 * 60; // Litecoin: 3.5 days
1076 // static const int64 nTargetSpacing = 2.5 * 60; // Litecoin: 2.5 minutes
1077 static const int64 nTargetTimespan = 256; // Czarcoin: 256 seconds
1078 static const int64 nTargetSpacing = 128; // Czarcoin: 128 Seconds
1079 static const int64 nInterval = nTargetTimespan / nTargetSpacing;
1080 
1081 //
1082 // minimum amount of work that could possibly be required nTime after
1083 // minimum work required was nBase
1084 //
1085 unsigned int ComputeMinWork(unsigned int nBase, int64 nTime)
1086 {
1087  // Testnet has min-difficulty blocks
1088  // after nTargetSpacing*2 time between blocks:
1089  if (fTestNet && nTime > nTargetSpacing*2)
1090  return bnProofOfWorkLimit.GetCompact();
1091 
1092  CBigNum bnResult;
1093  bnResult.SetCompact(nBase);
1094  while (nTime > 0 && bnResult < bnProofOfWorkLimit)
1095  {
1096  // Maximum 400% adjustment...
1097  bnResult *= 4;
1098  // ... in best-case exactly 4-times-normal target time
1099  nTime -= nTargetTimespan*4;
1100  }
1101  if (bnResult > bnProofOfWorkLimit)
1102  bnResult = bnProofOfWorkLimit;
1103  return bnResult.GetCompact();
1104 }
1105 
1106 unsigned int static GetNextWorkRequired(const CBlockIndex* pindexLast, const CBlockHeader *pblock)
1107 {
1108  unsigned int nProofOfWorkLimit = bnProofOfWorkLimit.GetCompact();
1109 
1110  // Genesis block
1111  if (pindexLast == NULL)
1112  return nProofOfWorkLimit;
1113 
1114  // Only change once per interval
1115  if ((pindexLast->nHeight+1) % nInterval != 0)
1116  {
1117  // Special difficulty rule for testnet:
1118  if (fTestNet)
1119  {
1120  // If the new block's timestamp is more than 2* 10 minutes
1121  // then allow mining of a min-difficulty block.
1122  if (pblock->nTime > pindexLast->nTime + nTargetSpacing*2)
1123  return nProofOfWorkLimit;
1124  else
1125  {
1126  // Return the last non-special-min-difficulty-rules-block
1127  const CBlockIndex* pindex = pindexLast;
1128  while (pindex->pprev && pindex->nHeight % nInterval != 0 && pindex->nBits == nProofOfWorkLimit)
1129  pindex = pindex->pprev;
1130  return pindex->nBits;
1131  }
1132  }
1133 
1134  return pindexLast->nBits;
1135  }
1136 
1137  // Czarcoin: This fixes an issue where a 51% attack can change difficulty at will.
1138  // Go back the full period unless it's the first retarget after genesis. Code courtesy of Art Forz
1139  int blockstogoback = nInterval-1;
1140  if ((pindexLast->nHeight+1) != nInterval)
1141  blockstogoback = nInterval;
1142 
1143  // Go back by what we want to be 14 days worth of blocks
1144  const CBlockIndex* pindexFirst = pindexLast;
1145  for (int i = 0; pindexFirst && i < blockstogoback; i++)
1146  pindexFirst = pindexFirst->pprev;
1147  assert(pindexFirst);
1148 
1149  // Limit adjustment step
1150  int64 nActualTimespan = pindexLast->GetBlockTime() - pindexFirst->GetBlockTime();
1151  printf(" nActualTimespan = %"PRI64d" before bounds\n", nActualTimespan);
1152  if (nActualTimespan < nTargetTimespan/4)
1153  nActualTimespan = nTargetTimespan/4;
1154  if (nActualTimespan > nTargetTimespan*4)
1155  nActualTimespan = nTargetTimespan*4;
1156 
1157  // Retarget
1158  CBigNum bnNew;
1159  bnNew.SetCompact(pindexLast->nBits);
1160  bnNew *= nActualTimespan;
1161  bnNew /= nTargetTimespan;
1162 
1163  if (bnNew > bnProofOfWorkLimit)
1164  bnNew = bnProofOfWorkLimit;
1165 
1167  printf("GetNextWorkRequired RETARGET\n");
1168  printf("nTargetTimespan = %"PRI64d" nActualTimespan = %"PRI64d"\n", nTargetTimespan, nActualTimespan);
1169  printf("Before: %08x %s\n", pindexLast->nBits, CBigNum().SetCompact(pindexLast->nBits).getuint256().ToString().c_str());
1170  printf("After: %08x %s\n", bnNew.GetCompact(), bnNew.getuint256().ToString().c_str());
1171 
1172  return bnNew.GetCompact();
1173 }
1174 
1175 bool CheckProofOfWork(uint256 hash, unsigned int nBits)
1176 {
1177  CBigNum bnTarget;
1178  bnTarget.SetCompact(nBits);
1179 
1180  // Check range
1181  if (bnTarget <= 0 || bnTarget > bnProofOfWorkLimit)
1182  return error("CheckProofOfWork() : nBits below minimum work");
1183 
1184  // Check proof of work matches claimed amount
1185  if (hash > bnTarget.getuint256())
1186  return error("CheckProofOfWork() : hash doesn't match nBits");
1187 
1188  return true;
1189 }

1197 bool IsInitialBlockDownload()
1198 {
1199  if (pindexBest == NULL || fImporting || fReindex || nBestHeight < Checkpoints::GetTotalBlocksEstimate())
1200  return true;
1201  static int64 nLastUpdate;
1202  static CBlockIndex* pindexLastBest;
1203  if (pindexBest != pindexLastBest)
1204  {
1205  pindexLastBest = pindexBest;
1206  nLastUpdate = GetTime();
1207  }
1208  return (GetTime() - nLastUpdate < 10 &&
1209  pindexBest->GetBlockTime() < GetTime() - 24 * 60 * 60);
1210 }

1212 void static InvalidChainFound(CBlockIndex* pindexNew)
1213 {
1214  if (pindexNew->nChainWork > nBestInvalidWork)
1215  {
1216  nBestInvalidWork = pindexNew->nChainWork;
1217  pblocktree->WriteBestInvalidWork(CBigNum(nBestInvalidWork));
1218  uiInterface.NotifyBlocksChanged();
1219  }
1220  printf("InvalidChainFound: invalid block=%s height=%d log2_work=%.8g date=%s\n",
1221  pindexNew->GetBlockHash().ToString().c_str(), pindexNew->nHeight,
1222  log(pindexNew->nChainWork.getdouble())/log(2.0), DateTimeStrFormat("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S",
1223  pindexNew->GetBlockTime()).c_str());
1224  printf("InvalidChainFound: current best=%s height=%d log2_work=%.8g date=%s\n",
1225  hashBestChain.ToString().c_str(), nBestHeight, log(nBestChainWork.getdouble())/log(2.0),
1226  DateTimeStrFormat("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S", pindexBest->GetBlockTime()).c_str());
1227  if (pindexBest && nBestInvalidWork > nBestChainWork + (pindexBest->GetBlockWork() * 6).getuint256())
1228  printf("InvalidChainFound: Warning: Displayed transactions may not be correct! You may need to upgrade, or other nodes may need to upgrade.\n");
1229 }
1230 
1231 void static InvalidBlockFound(CBlockIndex *pindex) {
1232  pindex->nStatus |= BLOCK_FAILED_VALID;
1233  pblocktree->WriteBlockIndex(CDiskBlockIndex(pindex));
1234  setBlockIndexValid.erase(pindex);
1235  InvalidChainFound(pindex);
1236  if (pindex->pnext) {
1237  CValidationState stateDummy;
1238  ConnectBestBlock(stateDummy); // reorganise away from the failed block
1239  }
1240 }
1241 
1242 bool ConnectBestBlock(CValidationState &state) {
1243  do {
1244  CBlockIndex *pindexNewBest;
1245 
1246  {
1247  std::set<CBlockIndex*,CBlockIndexWorkComparator>::reverse_iterator it = setBlockIndexValid.rbegin();
1248  if (it == setBlockIndexValid.rend())
1249  return true;
1250  pindexNewBest = *it;
1251  }
1252 
1253  if (pindexNewBest == pindexBest || (pindexBest && pindexNewBest->nChainWork == pindexBest->nChainWork))
1254  return true; // nothing to do
1255 
1256  // check ancestry
1257  CBlockIndex *pindexTest = pindexNewBest;
1258  std::vector<CBlockIndex*> vAttach;
1259  do {
1260  if (pindexTest->nStatus & BLOCK_FAILED_MASK) {
1261  // mark descendants failed
1262  CBlockIndex *pindexFailed = pindexNewBest;
1263  while (pindexTest != pindexFailed) {
1264  pindexFailed->nStatus |= BLOCK_FAILED_CHILD;
1265  setBlockIndexValid.erase(pindexFailed);
1266  pblocktree->WriteBlockIndex(CDiskBlockIndex(pindexFailed));
1267  pindexFailed = pindexFailed->pprev;
1268  }
1269  InvalidChainFound(pindexNewBest);
1270  break;
1271  }
1272 
1273  if (pindexBest == NULL || pindexTest->nChainWork > pindexBest->nChainWork)
1274  vAttach.push_back(pindexTest);
1275 
1276  if (pindexTest->pprev == NULL || pindexTest->pnext != NULL) {
1277  reverse(vAttach.begin(), vAttach.end());
1278  BOOST_FOREACH(CBlockIndex *pindexSwitch, vAttach) {
1279  boost::this_thread::interruption_point();
1280  try {
1281  if (!SetBestChain(state, pindexSwitch))
1282  return false;
1283  } catch(std::runtime_error &e) {
1284  return state.Abort(_("System error: ") + e.what());
1285  }
1286  }
1287  return true;
1288  }
1289  pindexTest = pindexTest->pprev;
1290  } while(true);
1291  } while(true);
1292 }

1294 void CBlockHeader::UpdateTime(const CBlockIndex* pindexPrev)
1295 {
1296  nTime = max(pindexPrev->GetMedianTimePast()+1, GetAdjustedTime());
1297 
1298  // Updating time can change work required on testnet:
1299  if (fTestNet)
1300  nBits = GetNextWorkRequired(pindexPrev, this);
1301 }

1320 int64 CTransaction::GetValueIn(CCoinsViewCache& inputs) const
1321 {
1322  if (IsCoinBase())
1323  return 0;
1324 
1325  int64 nResult = 0;
1326  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < vin.size(); i++)
1327  nResult += GetOutputFor(vin[i], inputs).nValue;
1328 
1329  return nResult;

1332 unsigned int CTransaction::GetP2SHSigOpCount(CCoinsViewCache& inputs) const
1333 {
1334  if (IsCoinBase())
1335  return 0;
1336 
1337  unsigned int nSigOps = 0;
1338  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < vin.size(); i++)
1339  {
1340  const CTxOut &prevout = GetOutputFor(vin[i], inputs);
1341  if (prevout.scriptPubKey.IsPayToScriptHash())
1342  nSigOps += prevout.scriptPubKey.GetSigOpCount(vin[i].scriptSig);
1343  }
1344  return nSigOps;
1345 }

1347 void CTransaction::UpdateCoins(CValidationState &state, CCoinsViewCache &inputs, CTxUndo &txundo, int nHeight, const uint256 &txhash) const
1348 {
1349  // mark inputs spent
1350  if (!IsCoinBase()) {
1351  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxIn &txin, vin) {
1352  CCoins &coins = inputs.GetCoins(txin.prevout.hash);
1353  CTxInUndo undo;
1354  assert(coins.Spend(txin.prevout, undo));
1355  txundo.vprevout.push_back(undo);
1356  }
1357  }
1358 
1359  // add outputs
1360  assert(inputs.SetCoins(txhash, CCoins(*this, nHeight)));
1361 }
1362 
1363 bool CTransaction::HaveInputs(CCoinsViewCache &inputs) const
1364 {
1365  if (!IsCoinBase()) {
1366  // first check whether information about the prevout hash is available
1367  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < vin.size(); i++) {
1368  const COutPoint &prevout = vin[i].prevout;
1369  if (!inputs.HaveCoins(prevout.hash))
1370  return false;
1371  }
1372 
1373  // then check whether the actual outputs are available
1374  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < vin.size(); i++) {
1375  const COutPoint &prevout = vin[i].prevout;
1376  const CCoins &coins = inputs.GetCoins(prevout.hash);
1377  if (!coins.IsAvailable(prevout.n))
1378  return false;
1379  }
1380  }
1381  return true;
1382 }

1384 bool CScriptCheck::operator()() const {
1385  const CScript &scriptSig = ptxTo->vin[nIn].scriptSig;
1386  if (!VerifyScript(scriptSig, scriptPubKey, *ptxTo, nIn, nFlags, nHashType))
1387  return error("CScriptCheck() : %s VerifySignature failed", ptxTo->GetHash().ToString().c_str());
1388  return true;
1389 }
1390 
1391 bool VerifySignature(const CCoins& txFrom, const CTransaction& txTo, unsigned int nIn, unsigned int flags, int nHashType)
1392 {
1393  return CScriptCheck(txFrom, txTo, nIn, flags, nHashType)();
1394 }
1395 
1396 bool CTransaction::CheckInputs(CValidationState &state, CCoinsViewCache &inputs, bool fScriptChecks, unsigned int flags, std::vector<CScriptCheck> *pvChecks) const
1397 {
1398  if (!IsCoinBase())
1399  {
1400  if (pvChecks)
1401  pvChecks->reserve(vin.size());
1402 
1403  // This doesn't trigger the DoS code on purpose; if it did, it would make it easier
1404  // for an attacker to attempt to split the network.
1405  if (!HaveInputs(inputs))
1406  return state.Invalid(error("CheckInputs() : %s inputs unavailable", GetHash().ToString().c_str()));
1407 
1408  // While checking, GetBestBlock() refers to the parent block.
1409  // This is also true for mempool checks.
1410  int nSpendHeight = inputs.GetBestBlock()->nHeight + 1;
1411  int64 nValueIn = 0;
1412  int64 nFees = 0;
1413  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < vin.size(); i++)
1414  {
1415  const COutPoint &prevout = vin[i].prevout;
1416  const CCoins &coins = inputs.GetCoins(prevout.hash);
1417 
1418  // If prev is coinbase, check that it's matured
1419  if (coins.IsCoinBase()) {
1420  if (nSpendHeight - coins.nHeight < COINBASE_MATURITY)
1421  return state.Invalid(error("CheckInputs() : tried to spend coinbase at depth %d", nSpendHeight - coins.nHeight));
1422  }
1423 
1424  // Check for negative or overflow input values
1425  nValueIn += coins.vout[prevout.n].nValue;
1426  if (!MoneyRange(coins.vout[prevout.n].nValue) || !MoneyRange(nValueIn))
1427  return state.DoS(100, error("CheckInputs() : txin values out of range"));
1428 
1429  }
1430 
1431  if (nValueIn < GetValueOut())
1432  return state.DoS(100, error("CheckInputs() : %s value in < value out", GetHash().ToString().c_str()));
1433 
1434  // Tally transaction fees
1435  int64 nTxFee = nValueIn - GetValueOut();
1436  if (nTxFee < 0)
1437  return state.DoS(100, error("CheckInputs() : %s nTxFee < 0", GetHash().ToString().c_str()));
1438  nFees += nTxFee;
1439  if (!MoneyRange(nFees))
1440  return state.DoS(100, error("CheckInputs() : nFees out of range"));
1441 
1442  // The first loop above does all the inexpensive checks.
1443  // Only if ALL inputs pass do we perform expensive ECDSA signature checks.
1444  // Helps prevent CPU exhaustion attacks.
1445 
1446  // Skip ECDSA signature verification when connecting blocks
1447  // before the last block chain checkpoint. This is safe because block merkle hashes are
1448  // still computed and checked, and any change will be caught at the next checkpoint.
1449  if (fScriptChecks) {
1450  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < vin.size(); i++) {
1451  const COutPoint &prevout = vin[i].prevout;
1452  const CCoins &coins = inputs.GetCoins(prevout.hash);
1453 
1454  // Verify signature
1455  CScriptCheck check(coins, *this, i, flags, 0);
1456  if (pvChecks) {
1457  pvChecks->push_back(CScriptCheck());
1458  check.swap(pvChecks->back());
1459  } else if (!check()) {
1460  if (flags & SCRIPT_VERIFY_STRICTENC) {
1461  // For now, check whether the failure was caused by non-canonical
1462  // encodings or not; if so, don't trigger DoS protection.
1463  CScriptCheck check(coins, *this, i, flags & (~SCRIPT_VERIFY_STRICTENC), 0);
1464  if (check())
1465  return state.Invalid();
1466  }
1467  return state.DoS(100,false);
1468  }
1469  }
1470  }
1471  }
1472 
1473  return true;
1474 }
1475 
1476

1478 
1479 bool CBlock::DisconnectBlock(CValidationState &state, CBlockIndex *pindex, CCoinsViewCache &view, bool *pfClean)
1480 {
1481  assert(pindex == view.GetBestBlock());
1482 
1483  if (pfClean)
1484  *pfClean = false;
1485 
1486  bool fClean = true;
1487 
1488  CBlockUndo blockUndo;
1489  CDiskBlockPos pos = pindex->GetUndoPos();
1490  if (pos.IsNull())
1491  return error("DisconnectBlock() : no undo data available");
1492  if (!blockUndo.ReadFromDisk(pos, pindex->pprev->GetBlockHash()))
1493  return error("DisconnectBlock() : failure reading undo data");
1494 
1495  if (blockUndo.vtxundo.size() + 1 != vtx.size())
1496  return error("DisconnectBlock() : block and undo data inconsistent");
1497 
1498  // undo transactions in reverse order
1499  for (int i = vtx.size() - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
1500  const CTransaction &tx = vtx[i];
1501  uint256 hash = tx.GetHash();
1502 
1503  // check that all outputs are available
1504  if (!view.HaveCoins(hash)) {
1505  fClean = fClean && error("DisconnectBlock() : outputs still spent? database corrupted");
1506  view.SetCoins(hash, CCoins());
1507  }
1508  CCoins &outs = view.GetCoins(hash);
1509 
1510  CCoins outsBlock = CCoins(tx, pindex->nHeight);
1511  // The CCoins serialization does not serialize negative numbers.
1512  // No network rules currently depend on the version here, so an inconsistency is harmless
1513  // but it must be corrected before txout nversion ever influences a network rule.
1514  if (outsBlock.nVersion < 0)
1515  outs.nVersion = outsBlock.nVersion;
1516  if (outs != outsBlock)
1517  fClean = fClean && error("DisconnectBlock() : added transaction mismatch? database corrupted");
1518 
1519  // remove outputs
1520  outs = CCoins();
1521 
1522  // restore inputs
1523  if (i > 0) { // not coinbases
1524  const CTxUndo &txundo = blockUndo.vtxundo[i-1];
1525  if (txundo.vprevout.size() != tx.vin.size())
1526  return error("DisconnectBlock() : transaction and undo data inconsistent");
1527  for (unsigned int j = tx.vin.size(); j-- > 0;) {
1528  const COutPoint &out = tx.vin[j].prevout;
1529  const CTxInUndo &undo = txundo.vprevout[j];
1530  CCoins coins;
1531  view.GetCoins(out.hash, coins); // this can fail if the prevout was already entirely spent
1532  if (undo.nHeight != 0) {
1533  // undo data contains height: this is the last output of the prevout tx being spent
1534  if (!coins.IsPruned())
1535  fClean = fClean && error("DisconnectBlock() : undo data overwriting existing transaction");
1536  coins = CCoins();
1537  coins.fCoinBase = undo.fCoinBase;
1538  coins.nHeight = undo.nHeight;
1539  coins.nVersion = undo.nVersion;
1540  } else {
1541  if (coins.IsPruned())
1542  fClean = fClean && error("DisconnectBlock() : undo data adding output to missing transaction");
1543  }
1544  if (coins.IsAvailable(out.n))
1545  fClean = fClean && error("DisconnectBlock() : undo data overwriting existing output");
1546  if (coins.vout.size() < out.n+1)
1547  coins.vout.resize(out.n+1);
1548  coins.vout[out.n] = undo.txout;
1549  if (!view.SetCoins(out.hash, coins))
1550  return error("DisconnectBlock() : cannot restore coin inputs");
1551  }
1552  }
1553  }
1554 
1555  // move best block pointer to prevout block
1556  view.SetBestBlock(pindex->pprev);
1557 
1558  if (pfClean) {
1559  *pfClean = fClean;
1560  return true;
1561  } else {
1562  return fClean;
1563  }
1564 }
1565 
1566 void static FlushBlockFile(bool fFinalize = false)
1567 {
1568  LOCK(cs_LastBlockFile);
1569 
1570  CDiskBlockPos posOld(nLastBlockFile, 0);
1571 
1572  FILE *fileOld = OpenBlockFile(posOld);
1573  if (fileOld) {
1574  if (fFinalize)
1575  TruncateFile(fileOld, infoLastBlockFile.nSize);
1576  FileCommit(fileOld);
1577  fclose(fileOld);
1578  }
1579 
1580  fileOld = OpenUndoFile(posOld);
1581  if (fileOld) {
1582  if (fFinalize)
1583  TruncateFile(fileOld, infoLastBlockFile.nUndoSize);
1584  FileCommit(fileOld);
1585  fclose(fileOld);
1586  }
1587 }

1591 static CCheckQueue<CScriptCheck> scriptcheckqueue(128);

1597 
1598 bool CBlock::ConnectBlock(CValidationState &state, CBlockIndex* pindex, CCoinsViewCache &view, bool fJustCheck)
1599 {
1600  // Check it again in case a previous version let a bad block in
1601  if (!CheckBlock(state, !fJustCheck, !fJustCheck))
1602  return false;
1603 
1604  // verify that the view's current state corresponds to the previous block
1605  assert(pindex->pprev == view.GetBestBlock());
1606 
1607  // Special case for the genesis block, skipping connection of its transactions
1608  // (its coinbase is unspendable)
1609  if (GetHash() == hashGenesisBlock) {
1610  view.SetBestBlock(pindex);
1611  pindexGenesisBlock = pindex;
1612  return true;
1613  }
1614 
1615  bool fScriptChecks = pindex->nHeight >= Checkpoints::GetTotalBlocksEstimate();
1616 
1617  // Do not allow blocks that contain transactions which 'overwrite' older transactions,
1618  // unless those are already completely spent.
1619  // If such overwrites are allowed, coinbases and transactions depending upon those
1620  // can be duplicated to remove the ability to spend the first instance -- even after
1621  // being sent to another address.
1622  // See BIP30 and http://r6.ca/blog/20120206T005236Z.html for more information.
1623  // This logic is not necessary for memory pool transactions, as AcceptToMemoryPool
1624  // already refuses previously-known transaction ids entirely.
1625  // This rule was originally applied all blocks whose timestamp was after October 1, 2012, 0:00 UTC.
1626  // Now that the whole chain is irreversibly beyond that time it is applied to all blocks,
1627  // this prevents exploiting the issue against nodes in their initial block download.
1628  bool fEnforceBIP30 = true;
1629 
1630  if (fEnforceBIP30) {
1631  for (unsigned int i=0; i<vtx.size(); i++) {
1632  uint256 hash = GetTxHash(i);
1633  if (view.HaveCoins(hash) && !view.GetCoins(hash).IsPruned())
1634  return state.DoS(100, error("ConnectBlock() : tried to overwrite transaction"));
1635  }
1636  }
1637 
1638  // BIP16 didn't become active until Oct 1 2012
1639  int64 nBIP16SwitchTime = 1349049600;
1640  bool fStrictPayToScriptHash = (pindex->nTime >= nBIP16SwitchTime);
1641 
1642  unsigned int flags = SCRIPT_VERIFY_NOCACHE |
1643  (fStrictPayToScriptHash ? SCRIPT_VERIFY_P2SH : SCRIPT_VERIFY_NONE);
1644 
1645  CBlockUndo blockundo;
1646 
1647  CCheckQueueControl<CScriptCheck> control(fScriptChecks && nScriptCheckThreads ? &scriptcheckqueue : NULL);
1648 
1649  int64 nStart = GetTimeMicros();
1650  int64 nFees = 0;
1651  int nInputs = 0;
1652  unsigned int nSigOps = 0;
1653  CDiskTxPos pos(pindex->GetBlockPos(), GetSizeOfCompactSize(vtx.size()));
1654  std::vector<std::pair<uint256, CDiskTxPos> > vPos;
1655  vPos.reserve(vtx.size());
1656  for (unsigned int i=0; i<vtx.size(); i++)
1657  {
1658  const CTransaction &tx = vtx[i];
1659 
1660  nInputs += tx.vin.size();
1661  nSigOps += tx.GetLegacySigOpCount();
1662  if (nSigOps > MAX_BLOCK_SIGOPS)
1663  return state.DoS(100, error("ConnectBlock() : too many sigops"));
1664 
1665  if (!tx.IsCoinBase())
1666  {
1667  if (!tx.HaveInputs(view))
1668  return state.DoS(100, error("ConnectBlock() : inputs missing/spent"));
1669 
1670  if (fStrictPayToScriptHash)
1671  {
1672  // Add in sigops done by pay-to-script-hash inputs;
1673  // this is to prevent a "rogue miner" from creating
1674  // an incredibly-expensive-to-validate block.
1675  nSigOps += tx.GetP2SHSigOpCount(view);
1676  if (nSigOps > MAX_BLOCK_SIGOPS)
1677  return state.DoS(100, error("ConnectBlock() : too many sigops"));
1678  }
1679 
1680  nFees += tx.GetValueIn(view)-tx.GetValueOut();
1681 
1682  std::vector<CScriptCheck> vChecks;
1683  if (!tx.CheckInputs(state, view, fScriptChecks, flags, nScriptCheckThreads ? &vChecks : NULL))
1684  return false;
1685  control.Add(vChecks);
1686  }
1687 
1688  CTxUndo txundo;
1689  tx.UpdateCoins(state, view, txundo, pindex->nHeight, GetTxHash(i));
1690  if (!tx.IsCoinBase())
1691  blockundo.vtxundo.push_back(txundo);
1692 
1693  vPos.push_back(std::make_pair(GetTxHash(i), pos));
1694  pos.nTxOffset += ::GetSerializeSize(tx, SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION);
1695  }
1696  int64 nTime = GetTimeMicros() - nStart;
1697  if (fBenchmark)
1698  printf("- Connect %u transactions: %.2fms (%.3fms/tx, %.3fms/txin)\n", (unsigned)vtx.size(), 0.001 * nTime, 0.001 * nTime / vtx.size(), nInputs <= 1 ? 0 : 0.001 * nTime / (nInputs-1));
1699 
1700  if (vtx[0].GetValueOut() > GetBlockValue(pindex->nHeight, nFees))
1701  return state.DoS(100, error("ConnectBlock() : coinbase pays too much (actual=%"PRI64d" vs limit=%"PRI64d")", vtx[0].GetValueOut(), GetBlockValue(pindex->nHeight, nFees)));
1702 
1703  if (!control.Wait())
1704  return state.DoS(100, false);
1705  int64 nTime2 = GetTimeMicros() - nStart;
1706  if (fBenchmark)
1707  printf("- Verify %u txins: %.2fms (%.3fms/txin)\n", nInputs - 1, 0.001 * nTime2, nInputs <= 1 ? 0 : 0.001 * nTime2 / (nInputs-1));
1708 
1709  if (fJustCheck)
1710  return true;
1711 
1712  // Write undo information to disk
1713  if (pindex->GetUndoPos().IsNull() || (pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_VALID_MASK) < BLOCK_VALID_SCRIPTS)
1714  {
1715  if (pindex->GetUndoPos().IsNull()) {
1716  CDiskBlockPos pos;
1717  if (!FindUndoPos(state, pindex->nFile, pos, ::GetSerializeSize(blockundo, SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION) + 40))
1718  return error("ConnectBlock() : FindUndoPos failed");
1719  if (!blockundo.WriteToDisk(pos, pindex->pprev->GetBlockHash()))
1720  return state.Abort(_("Failed to write undo data"));
1721 
1722  // update nUndoPos in block index
1723  pindex->nUndoPos = pos.nPos;
1724  pindex->nStatus |= BLOCK_HAVE_UNDO;
1725  }
1726 
1727  pindex->nStatus = (pindex->nStatus & ~BLOCK_VALID_MASK) | BLOCK_VALID_SCRIPTS;
1728 
1729  CDiskBlockIndex blockindex(pindex);
1730  if (!pblocktree->WriteBlockIndex(blockindex))
1731  return state.Abort(_("Failed to write block index"));
1732  }
1733 
1734  if (fTxIndex)
1735  if (!pblocktree->WriteTxIndex(vPos))
1736  return state.Abort(_("Failed to write transaction index"));
1737 
1738  // add this block to the view's block chain
1739  assert(view.SetBestBlock(pindex));
1740 
1741  // Watch for transactions paying to me
1742  for (unsigned int i=0; i<vtx.size(); i++)
1743  SyncWithWallets(GetTxHash(i), vtx[i], this, true);
1744 
1745  return true;
1746 }
1747 
1748 bool SetBestChain(CValidationState &state, CBlockIndex* pindexNew)
1749 {
1750  // All modifications to the coin state will be done in this cache.
1751  // Only when all have succeeded, we push it to pcoinsTip.
1752  CCoinsViewCache view(*pcoinsTip, true);
1753 
1754  // Find the fork (typically, there is none)
1755  CBlockIndex* pfork = view.GetBestBlock();
1756  CBlockIndex* plonger = pindexNew;
1757  while (pfork && pfork != plonger)
1758  {
1759  while (plonger->nHeight > pfork->nHeight) {
1760  plonger = plonger->pprev;
1761  assert(plonger != NULL);
1762  }
1763  if (pfork == plonger)
1764  break;
1765  pfork = pfork->pprev;
1766  assert(pfork != NULL);
1767  }
1768 
1769  // List of what to disconnect (typically nothing)
1770  vector<CBlockIndex*> vDisconnect;
1771  for (CBlockIndex* pindex = view.GetBestBlock(); pindex != pfork; pindex = pindex->pprev)
1772  vDisconnect.push_back(pindex);
1773 
1774  // List of what to connect (typically only pindexNew)
1775  vector<CBlockIndex*> vConnect;
1776  for (CBlockIndex* pindex = pindexNew; pindex != pfork; pindex = pindex->pprev)
1777  vConnect.push_back(pindex);
1778  reverse(vConnect.begin(), vConnect.end());
1779 
1780  if (vDisconnect.size() > 0) {
1781  printf("REORGANIZE: Disconnect %"PRIszu" blocks; %s..\n", vDisconnect.size(), pfork->GetBlockHash().ToString().c_str());
1782  printf("REORGANIZE: Connect %"PRIszu" blocks; ..%s\n", vConnect.size(), pindexNew->GetBlockHash().ToString().c_str());
1783  }
1784 
1785  // Disconnect shorter branch
1786  vector<CTransaction> vResurrect;
1787  BOOST_FOREACH(CBlockIndex* pindex, vDisconnect) {
1788  CBlock block;
1789  if (!block.ReadFromDisk(pindex))
1790  return state.Abort(_("Failed to read block"));
1791  int64 nStart = GetTimeMicros();
1792  if (!block.DisconnectBlock(state, pindex, view))
1793  return error("SetBestBlock() : DisconnectBlock %s failed", pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString().c_str());
1794  if (fBenchmark)
1795  printf("- Disconnect: %.2fms\n", (GetTimeMicros() - nStart) * 0.001);
1796 
1797  // Queue memory transactions to resurrect.
1798  // We only do this for blocks after the last checkpoint (reorganisation before that
1799  // point should only happen with -reindex/-loadblock, or a misbehaving peer.
1800  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTransaction& tx, block.vtx)
1801  if (!tx.IsCoinBase() && pindex->nHeight > Checkpoints::GetTotalBlocksEstimate())
1802  vResurrect.push_back(tx);
1803  }
1804 
1805  // Connect longer branch
1806  vector<CTransaction> vDelete;
1807  BOOST_FOREACH(CBlockIndex *pindex, vConnect) {
1808  CBlock block;
1809  if (!block.ReadFromDisk(pindex))
1810  return state.Abort(_("Failed to read block"));
1811  int64 nStart = GetTimeMicros();
1812  if (!block.ConnectBlock(state, pindex, view)) {
1813  if (state.IsInvalid()) {
1814  InvalidChainFound(pindexNew);
1815  InvalidBlockFound(pindex);
1816  }
1817  return error("SetBestBlock() : ConnectBlock %s failed", pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString().c_str());
1818  }
1819  if (fBenchmark)
1820  printf("- Connect: %.2fms\n", (GetTimeMicros() - nStart) * 0.001);
1821 
1822  // Queue memory transactions to delete
1823  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTransaction& tx, block.vtx)
1824  vDelete.push_back(tx);
1825  }
1826 
1827  // Flush changes to global coin state
1828  int64 nStart = GetTimeMicros();
1829  int nModified = view.GetCacheSize();
1830  assert(view.Flush());
1831  int64 nTime = GetTimeMicros() - nStart;
1832  if (fBenchmark)
1833  printf("- Flush %i transactions: %.2fms (%.4fms/tx)\n", nModified, 0.001 * nTime, 0.001 * nTime / nModified);
1834 
1835  // Make sure it's successfully written to disk before changing memory structure
1836  bool fIsInitialDownload = IsInitialBlockDownload();
1837  if (!fIsInitialDownload || pcoinsTip->GetCacheSize() > nCoinCacheSize) {
1838  // Typical CCoins structures on disk are around 100 bytes in size.
1839  // Pushing a new one to the database can cause it to be written
1840  // twice (once in the log, and once in the tables). This is already
1841  // an overestimation, as most will delete an existing entry or
1842  // overwrite one. Still, use a conservative safety factor of 2.
1843  if (!CheckDiskSpace(100 * 2 * 2 * pcoinsTip->GetCacheSize()))
1844  return state.Error();
1845  FlushBlockFile();
1846  pblocktree->Sync();
1847  if (!pcoinsTip->Flush())
1848  return state.Abort(_("Failed to write to coin database"));
1849  }
1850 
1851  // At this point, all changes have been done to the database.
1852  // Proceed by updating the memory structures.
1853 
1854  // Disconnect shorter branch
1855  BOOST_FOREACH(CBlockIndex* pindex, vDisconnect)
1856  if (pindex->pprev)
1857  pindex->pprev->pnext = NULL;
1858 
1859  // Connect longer branch
1860  BOOST_FOREACH(CBlockIndex* pindex, vConnect)
1861  if (pindex->pprev)
1862  pindex->pprev->pnext = pindex;
1863 
1864  // Resurrect memory transactions that were in the disconnected branch
1865  BOOST_FOREACH(CTransaction& tx, vResurrect) {
1866  // ignore validation errors in resurrected transactions
1867  CValidationState stateDummy;
1868  if (!tx.AcceptToMemoryPool(stateDummy, true, false))
1869  mempool.remove(tx, true);
1870  }
1871 
1872  // Delete redundant memory transactions that are in the connected branch
1873  BOOST_FOREACH(CTransaction& tx, vDelete) {
1874  mempool.remove(tx);
1875  mempool.removeConflicts(tx);
1876  }
1877 
1878  // Update best block in wallet (so we can detect restored wallets)
1879  if ((pindexNew->nHeight % 20160) == 0 || (!fIsInitialDownload && (pindexNew->nHeight % 144) == 0))
1880  {
1881  const CBlockLocator locator(pindexNew);
1882  ::SetBestChain(locator);
1883  }
1884 
1885  // New best block
1886  hashBestChain = pindexNew->GetBlockHash();
1887  pindexBest = pindexNew;
1888  pblockindexFBBHLast = NULL;
1889  nBestHeight = pindexBest->nHeight;
1890  nBestChainWork = pindexNew->nChainWork;
1891  nTimeBestReceived = GetTime();
1892  nTransactionsUpdated++;
1893  printf("SetBestChain: new best=%s height=%d log2_work=%.8g tx=%lu date=%s progress=%f\n",
1894  hashBestChain.ToString().c_str(), nBestHeight, log(nBestChainWork.getdouble())/log(2.0), (unsigned long)pindexNew->nChainTx,
1895  DateTimeStrFormat("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S", pindexBest->GetBlockTime()).c_str(),
1896  Checkpoints::GuessVerificationProgress(pindexBest));
1897 
1898  // Check the version of the last 100 blocks to see if we need to upgrade:
1899  if (!fIsInitialDownload)
1900  {
1901  int nUpgraded = 0;
1902  const CBlockIndex* pindex = pindexBest;
1903  for (int i = 0; i < 100 && pindex != NULL; i++)
1904  {
1905  if (pindex->nVersion > CBlock::CURRENT_VERSION)
1906  ++nUpgraded;
1907  pindex = pindex->pprev;
1908  }
1909  if (nUpgraded > 0)
1910  printf("SetBestChain: %d of last 100 blocks above version %d\n", nUpgraded, CBlock::CURRENT_VERSION);
1911  if (nUpgraded > 100/2)
1912  // strMiscWarning is read by GetWarnings(), called by Qt and the JSON-RPC code to warn the user:
1913  strMiscWarning = _("Warning: This version is obsolete, upgrade required!");
1914  }
1915 
1916  std::string strCmd = GetArg("-blocknotify", "");
1917 
1918  if (!fIsInitialDownload && !strCmd.empty())
1919  {
1920  boost::replace_all(strCmd, "%s", hashBestChain.GetHex());
1921  boost::thread t(runCommand, strCmd); // thread runs free
1922  }
1923 
1924  return true;
1925 }

1928 bool CBlock::AddToBlockIndex(CValidationState &state, const CDiskBlockPos &pos)
1929 {
1930  // Check for duplicate
1931  uint256 hash = GetHash();
1932  if (mapBlockIndex.count(hash))
1933  return state.Invalid(error("AddToBlockIndex() : %s already exists", hash.ToString().c_str()));
1934 
1935  // Construct new block index object
1936  CBlockIndex* pindexNew = new CBlockIndex(*this);
1937  assert(pindexNew);
1938  map<uint256, CBlockIndex*>::iterator mi = mapBlockIndex.insert(make_pair(hash, pindexNew)).first;
1939  pindexNew->phashBlock = &((*mi).first);
1940  map<uint256, CBlockIndex*>::iterator miPrev = mapBlockIndex.find(hashPrevBlock);
1941  if (miPrev != mapBlockIndex.end())
1942  {
1943  pindexNew->pprev = (*miPrev).second;
1944  pindexNew->nHeight = pindexNew->pprev->nHeight + 1;
1945  }
1946  pindexNew->nTx = vtx.size();
1947  pindexNew->nChainWork = (pindexNew->pprev ? pindexNew->pprev->nChainWork : 0) + pindexNew->GetBlockWork().getuint256();
1948  pindexNew->nChainTx = (pindexNew->pprev ? pindexNew->pprev->nChainTx : 0) + pindexNew->nTx;
1949  pindexNew->nFile = pos.nFile;
1950  pindexNew->nDataPos = pos.nPos;
1951  pindexNew->nUndoPos = 0;
1952  pindexNew->nStatus = BLOCK_VALID_TRANSACTIONS | BLOCK_HAVE_DATA;
1953  setBlockIndexValid.insert(pindexNew);
1954 
1955  if (!pblocktree->WriteBlockIndex(CDiskBlockIndex(pindexNew)))
1956  return state.Abort(_("Failed to write block index"));
1957 
1958  // New best?
1959  if (!ConnectBestBlock(state))
1960  return false;
1961 
1962  if (pindexNew == pindexBest)
1963  {
1964  // Notify UI to display prev block's coinbase if it was ours
1965  static uint256 hashPrevBestCoinBase;
1966  UpdatedTransaction(hashPrevBestCoinBase);
1967  hashPrevBestCoinBase = GetTxHash(0);
1968  }
1969 
1970  if (!pblocktree->Flush())
1971  return state.Abort(_("Failed to sync block index"));
1972 
1973  uiInterface.NotifyBlocksChanged();
1974  return true;
1975 }

1978 bool FindBlockPos(CValidationState &state, CDiskBlockPos &pos, unsigned int nAddSize, unsigned int nHeight, uint64 nTime, bool fKnown = false)
1979 {
1980  bool fUpdatedLast = false;
1981 
1982  LOCK(cs_LastBlockFile);
1983 
1984  if (fKnown) {
1985  if (nLastBlockFile != pos.nFile) {
1986  nLastBlockFile = pos.nFile;
1987  infoLastBlockFile.SetNull();
1988  pblocktree->ReadBlockFileInfo(nLastBlockFile, infoLastBlockFile);
1989  fUpdatedLast = true;
1990  }
1991  } else {
1992  while (infoLastBlockFile.nSize + nAddSize >= MAX_BLOCKFILE_SIZE) {
1993  printf("Leaving block file %i: %s\n", nLastBlockFile, infoLastBlockFile.ToString().c_str());
1994  FlushBlockFile(true);
1995  nLastBlockFile++;
1996  infoLastBlockFile.SetNull();
1997  pblocktree->ReadBlockFileInfo(nLastBlockFile, infoLastBlockFile); // check whether data for the new file somehow already exist; can fail just fine
1998  fUpdatedLast = true;
1999  }
2000  pos.nFile = nLastBlockFile;
2001  pos.nPos = infoLastBlockFile.nSize;
2002  }
2003 
2004  infoLastBlockFile.nSize += nAddSize;
2005  infoLastBlockFile.AddBlock(nHeight, nTime);
2006 
2007  if (!fKnown) {
2008  unsigned int nOldChunks = (pos.nPos + BLOCKFILE_CHUNK_SIZE - 1) / BLOCKFILE_CHUNK_SIZE;
2009  unsigned int nNewChunks = (infoLastBlockFile.nSize + BLOCKFILE_CHUNK_SIZE - 1) / BLOCKFILE_CHUNK_SIZE;
2010  if (nNewChunks > nOldChunks) {
2011  if (CheckDiskSpace(nNewChunks * BLOCKFILE_CHUNK_SIZE - pos.nPos)) {
2012  FILE *file = OpenBlockFile(pos);
2013  if (file) {
2014  printf("Pre-allocating up to position 0x%x in blk%05u.dat\n", nNewChunks * BLOCKFILE_CHUNK_SIZE, pos.nFile);
2015  AllocateFileRange(file, pos.nPos, nNewChunks * BLOCKFILE_CHUNK_SIZE - pos.nPos);
2016  fclose(file);
2017  }
2018  }
2019  else
2020  return state.Error();
2021  }
2022  }
2023 
2024  if (!pblocktree->WriteBlockFileInfo(nLastBlockFile, infoLastBlockFile))
2025  return state.Abort(_("Failed to write file info"));
2026  if (fUpdatedLast)
2027  pblocktree->WriteLastBlockFile(nLastBlockFile);
2028 
2029  return true;
2030 }
2031 
2032 bool FindUndoPos(CValidationState &state, int nFile, CDiskBlockPos &pos, unsigned int nAddSize)
2033 {
2034  pos.nFile = nFile;
2035 
2036  LOCK(cs_LastBlockFile);
2037 
2038  unsigned int nNewSize;
2039  if (nFile == nLastBlockFile) {
2040  pos.nPos = infoLastBlockFile.nUndoSize;
2041  nNewSize = (infoLastBlockFile.nUndoSize += nAddSize);
2042  if (!pblocktree->WriteBlockFileInfo(nLastBlockFile, infoLastBlockFile))
2043  return state.Abort(_("Failed to write block info"));
2044  } else {
2045  CBlockFileInfo info;
2046  if (!pblocktree->ReadBlockFileInfo(nFile, info))
2047  return state.Abort(_("Failed to read block info"));
2048  pos.nPos = info.nUndoSize;
2049  nNewSize = (info.nUndoSize += nAddSize);
2050  if (!pblocktree->WriteBlockFileInfo(nFile, info))
2051  return state.Abort(_("Failed to write block info"));
2052  }
2053 
2054  unsigned int nOldChunks = (pos.nPos + UNDOFILE_CHUNK_SIZE - 1) / UNDOFILE_CHUNK_SIZE;
2055  unsigned int nNewChunks = (nNewSize + UNDOFILE_CHUNK_SIZE - 1) / UNDOFILE_CHUNK_SIZE;
2056  if (nNewChunks > nOldChunks) {
2057  if (CheckDiskSpace(nNewChunks * UNDOFILE_CHUNK_SIZE - pos.nPos)) {
2058  FILE *file = OpenUndoFile(pos);
2059  if (file) {
2060  printf("Pre-allocating up to position 0x%x in rev%05u.dat\n", nNewChunks * UNDOFILE_CHUNK_SIZE, pos.nFile);
2061  AllocateFileRange(file, pos.nPos, nNewChunks * UNDOFILE_CHUNK_SIZE - pos.nPos);
2062  fclose(file);
2063  }
2064  }
2065  else
2066  return state.Error();
2067  }
2068 
2069  return true;
2070 }

2072 
2073 bool CBlock::CheckBlock(CValidationState &state, bool fCheckPOW, bool fCheckMerkleRoot) const
2074 {
2075  // These are checks that are independent of context
2076  // that can be verified before saving an orphan block.
2077 
2078  // Size limits
2079  if (vtx.empty() || vtx.size() > MAX_BLOCK_SIZE || ::GetSerializeSize(*this, SER_NETWORK, PROTOCOL_VERSION) > MAX_BLOCK_SIZE)
2080  return state.DoS(100, error("CheckBlock() : size limits failed"));
2081 
2082  // Czarcoin: Special short-term limits to avoid 10,000 BDB lock limit:
2083  if (GetBlockTime() < 1376568000) // stop enforcing 15 August 2013 00:00:00
2084  {
2085  // Rule is: #unique txids referenced <= 4,500
2086  // ... to prevent 10,000 BDB lock exhaustion on old clients
2087  set<uint256> setTxIn;
2088  for (size_t i = 0; i < vtx.size(); i++)
2089  {
2090  setTxIn.insert(vtx[i].GetHash());
2091  if (i == 0) continue; // skip coinbase txin
2092  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxIn& txin, vtx[i].vin)
2093  setTxIn.insert(txin.prevout.hash);
2094  }
2095  size_t nTxids = setTxIn.size();
2096  if (nTxids > 4500)
2097  return error("CheckBlock() : 15 August maxlocks violation");
2098  }
2099 
2100  // Check proof of work matches claimed amount
2101  if (fCheckPOW && !CheckProofOfWork(GetPoWHash(), nBits))
2102  return state.DoS(50, error("CheckBlock() : proof of work failed"));
2103 
2104  // Check timestamp
2105  if (GetBlockTime() > GetAdjustedTime() + 2 * 60 * 60)
2106  return state.Invalid(error("CheckBlock() : block timestamp too far in the future"));
2107 
2108  // First transaction must be coinbase, the rest must not be
2109  if (vtx.empty() || !vtx[0].IsCoinBase())
2110  return state.DoS(100, error("CheckBlock() : first tx is not coinbase"));
2111  for (unsigned int i = 1; i < vtx.size(); i++)
2112  if (vtx[i].IsCoinBase())
2113  return state.DoS(100, error("CheckBlock() : more than one coinbase"));
2114 
2115  // Check transactions
2116  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTransaction& tx, vtx)
2117  if (!tx.CheckTransaction(state))
2118  return error("CheckBlock() : CheckTransaction failed");
2119 
2120  // Build the merkle tree already. We need it anyway later, and it makes the
2121  // block cache the transaction hashes, which means they don't need to be
2122  // recalculated many times during this block's validation.
2123  BuildMerkleTree();
2124 
2125  // Check for duplicate txids. This is caught by ConnectInputs(),
2126  // but catching it earlier avoids a potential DoS attack:
2127  set<uint256> uniqueTx;
2128  for (unsigned int i=0; i<vtx.size(); i++) {
2129  uniqueTx.insert(GetTxHash(i));
2130  }
2131  if (uniqueTx.size() != vtx.size())
2132  return state.DoS(100, error("CheckBlock() : duplicate transaction"), true);
2133 
2134  unsigned int nSigOps = 0;
2135  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTransaction& tx, vtx)
2136  {
2137  nSigOps += tx.GetLegacySigOpCount();
2138  }
2139  if (nSigOps > MAX_BLOCK_SIGOPS)
2140  return state.DoS(100, error("CheckBlock() : out-of-bounds SigOpCount"));
2141 
2142  // Check merkle root
2143  if (fCheckMerkleRoot && hashMerkleRoot != BuildMerkleTree())
2144  return state.DoS(100, error("CheckBlock() : hashMerkleRoot mismatch"));
2145 
2146  return true;
2147 }
2148 
2149 bool CBlock::AcceptBlock(CValidationState &state, CDiskBlockPos *dbp)
2150 {
2151  // Check for duplicate
2152  uint256 hash = GetHash();
2153  if (mapBlockIndex.count(hash))
2154  return state.Invalid(error("AcceptBlock() : block already in mapBlockIndex"));
2155 
2156  // Get prev block index
2157  CBlockIndex* pindexPrev = NULL;
2158  int nHeight = 0;
2159  if (hash != hashGenesisBlock) {
2160  map<uint256, CBlockIndex*>::iterator mi = mapBlockIndex.find(hashPrevBlock);
2161  if (mi == mapBlockIndex.end())
2162  return state.DoS(10, error("AcceptBlock() : prev block not found"));
2163  pindexPrev = (*mi).second;
2164  nHeight = pindexPrev->nHeight+1;
2165 
2166  // Check proof of work
2167  if (nBits != GetNextWorkRequired(pindexPrev, this))
2168  return state.DoS(100, error("AcceptBlock() : incorrect proof of work"));
2169 
2170  // Check timestamp against prev
2171  if (GetBlockTime() <= pindexPrev->GetMedianTimePast())
2172  return state.Invalid(error("AcceptBlock() : block's timestamp is too early"));
2173 
2174  // Check that all transactions are finalized
2175  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTransaction& tx, vtx)
2176  if (!tx.IsFinal(nHeight, GetBlockTime()))
2177  return state.DoS(10, error("AcceptBlock() : contains a non-final transaction"));
2178 
2179  // Check that the block chain matches the known block chain up to a checkpoint
2180  if (!Checkpoints::CheckBlock(nHeight, hash))
2181  return state.DoS(100, error("AcceptBlock() : rejected by checkpoint lock-in at %d", nHeight));
2182 
2183  // Don't accept any forks from the main chain prior to last checkpoint
2184  CBlockIndex* pcheckpoint = Checkpoints::GetLastCheckpoint(mapBlockIndex);
2185  if (pcheckpoint && nHeight < pcheckpoint->nHeight)
2186  return state.DoS(100, error("AcceptBlock() : forked chain older than last checkpoint (height %d)", nHeight));
2187 
2188  // Reject block.nVersion=1 blocks when 95% (75% on testnet) of the network has upgraded:
2189  if (nVersion < 2)
2190  {
2191  if ((!fTestNet && CBlockIndex::IsSuperMajority(2, pindexPrev, 950, 1000)) ||
2192  (fTestNet && CBlockIndex::IsSuperMajority(2, pindexPrev, 75, 100)))
2193  {
2194  return state.Invalid(error("AcceptBlock() : rejected nVersion=1 block"));
2195  }
2196  }
2197  // Enforce block.nVersion=2 rule that the coinbase starts with serialized block height
2198  if (nVersion >= 2)
2199  {
2200  // if 750 of the last 1,000 blocks are version 2 or greater (51/100 if testnet):
2201  if ((!fTestNet && CBlockIndex::IsSuperMajority(2, pindexPrev, 750, 1000)) ||
2202  (fTestNet && CBlockIndex::IsSuperMajority(2, pindexPrev, 51, 100)))
2203  {
2204  CScript expect = CScript() << nHeight;
2205  if (vtx[0].vin[0].scriptSig.size() < expect.size() ||
2206  !std::equal(expect.begin(), expect.end(), vtx[0].vin[0].scriptSig.begin()))
2207  return state.DoS(100, error("AcceptBlock() : block height mismatch in coinbase"));
2208  }
2209  }
2210  }
2211 
2212  // Write block to history file
2213  try {
2214  unsigned int nBlockSize = ::GetSerializeSize(*this, SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION);
2215  CDiskBlockPos blockPos;
2216  if (dbp != NULL)
2217  blockPos = *dbp;
2218  if (!FindBlockPos(state, blockPos, nBlockSize+8, nHeight, nTime, dbp != NULL))
2219  return error("AcceptBlock() : FindBlockPos failed");
2220  if (dbp == NULL)
2221  if (!WriteToDisk(blockPos))
2222  return state.Abort(_("Failed to write block"));
2223  if (!AddToBlockIndex(state, blockPos))
2224  return error("AcceptBlock() : AddToBlockIndex failed");
2225  } catch(std::runtime_error &e) {
2226  return state.Abort(_("System error: ") + e.what());
2227  }
2228 
2229  // Relay inventory, but don't relay old inventory during initial block download
2230  int nBlockEstimate = Checkpoints::GetTotalBlocksEstimate();
2231  if (hashBestChain == hash)
2232  {
2233  LOCK(cs_vNodes);
2234  BOOST_FOREACH(CNode* pnode, vNodes)
2235  if (nBestHeight > (pnode->nStartingHeight != -1 ? pnode->nStartingHeight - 2000 : nBlockEstimate))
2236  pnode->PushInventory(CInv(MSG_BLOCK, hash));
2237  }
2238 
2239  return true;
2240 }
2241 
2242 bool CBlockIndex::IsSuperMajority(int minVersion, const CBlockIndex* pstart, unsigned int nRequired, unsigned int nToCheck)
2243 {
2244  // Czarcoin: temporarily disable v2 block lockin until we are ready for v2 transition
2245  return false;
2246  unsigned int nFound = 0;
2247  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < nToCheck && nFound < nRequired && pstart != NULL; i++)
2248  {
2249  if (pstart->nVersion >= minVersion)
2250  ++nFound;
2251  pstart = pstart->pprev;
2252  }
2253  return (nFound >= nRequired);
2254 }
2255 
2256 bool ProcessBlock(CValidationState &state, CNode* pfrom, CBlock* pblock, CDiskBlockPos *dbp)
2257 {
2258  // Check for duplicate
2259  uint256 hash = pblock->GetHash();
2260  if (mapBlockIndex.count(hash))
2261  return state.Invalid(error("ProcessBlock() : already have block %d %s", mapBlockIndex[hash]->nHeight, hash.ToString().c_str()));
2262  if (mapOrphanBlocks.count(hash))
2263  return state.Invalid(error("ProcessBlock() : already have block (orphan) %s", hash.ToString().c_str()));
2264 
2265  // Preliminary checks
2266  if (!pblock->CheckBlock(state))
2267  return error("ProcessBlock() : CheckBlock FAILED");
2268 
2269  CBlockIndex* pcheckpoint = Checkpoints::GetLastCheckpoint(mapBlockIndex);
2270  if (pcheckpoint && pblock->hashPrevBlock != hashBestChain)
2271  {
2272  // Extra checks to prevent "fill up memory by spamming with bogus blocks"
2273  int64 deltaTime = pblock->GetBlockTime() - pcheckpoint->nTime;
2274  if (deltaTime < 0)
2275  {
2276  return state.DoS(100, error("ProcessBlock() : block with timestamp before last checkpoint"));
2277  }
2278  CBigNum bnNewBlock;
2279  bnNewBlock.SetCompact(pblock->nBits);
2280  CBigNum bnRequired;
2281  bnRequired.SetCompact(ComputeMinWork(pcheckpoint->nBits, deltaTime));
2282  if (bnNewBlock > bnRequired)
2283  {
2284  return state.DoS(100, error("ProcessBlock() : block with too little proof-of-work"));
2285  }
2286  }
2287 
2288 
2289  // If we don't already have its previous block, shunt it off to holding area until we get it
2290  if (pblock->hashPrevBlock != 0 && !mapBlockIndex.count(pblock->hashPrevBlock))
2291  {
2292  printf("ProcessBlock: ORPHAN BLOCK, prev=%s\n", pblock->hashPrevBlock.ToString().c_str());
2293 
2294  // Accept orphans as long as there is a node to request its parents from
2295  if (pfrom) {
2296  CBlock* pblock2 = new CBlock(*pblock);
2297  mapOrphanBlocks.insert(make_pair(hash, pblock2));
2298  mapOrphanBlocksByPrev.insert(make_pair(pblock2->hashPrevBlock, pblock2));
2299 
2300  // Ask this guy to fill in what we're missing
2301  pfrom->PushGetBlocks(pindexBest, GetOrphanRoot(pblock2));
2302  }
2303  return true;
2304  }
2305 
2306  // Store to disk
2307  if (!pblock->AcceptBlock(state, dbp))
2308  return error("ProcessBlock() : AcceptBlock FAILED");
2309 
2310  // Recursively process any orphan blocks that depended on this one
2311  vector<uint256> vWorkQueue;
2312  vWorkQueue.push_back(hash);
2313  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < vWorkQueue.size(); i++)
2314  {
2315  uint256 hashPrev = vWorkQueue[i];
2316  for (multimap<uint256, CBlock*>::iterator mi = mapOrphanBlocksByPrev.lower_bound(hashPrev);
2317  mi != mapOrphanBlocksByPrev.upper_bound(hashPrev);
2318  ++mi)
2319  {
2320  CBlock* pblockOrphan = (*mi).second;
2321  // Use a dummy CValidationState so someone can't setup nodes to counter-DoS based on orphan resolution (that is, feeding people an invalid block based on LegitBlockX in order to get anyone relaying LegitBlockX banned)
2322  CValidationState stateDummy;
2323  if (pblockOrphan->AcceptBlock(stateDummy))
2324  vWorkQueue.push_back(pblockOrphan->GetHash());
2325  mapOrphanBlocks.erase(pblockOrphan->GetHash());
2326  delete pblockOrphan;
2327  }
2328  mapOrphanBlocksByPrev.erase(hashPrev);
2329  }
2330 
2331  printf("ProcessBlock: ACCEPTED\n");
2332  return true;
2333 }

2342 CMerkleBlock::CMerkleBlock(const CBlock& block, CBloomFilter& filter)
2343 {
2344  header = block.GetBlockHeader();
2345 
2346  vector<bool> vMatch;
2347  vector<uint256> vHashes;
2348 
2349  vMatch.reserve(block.vtx.size());
2350  vHashes.reserve(block.vtx.size());
2351 
2352  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < block.vtx.size(); i++)
2353  {
2354  uint256 hash = block.vtx[i].GetHash();
2355  if (filter.IsRelevantAndUpdate(block.vtx[i], hash))
2356  {
2357  vMatch.push_back(true);
2358  vMatchedTxn.push_back(make_pair(i, hash));
2359  }
2360  else
2361  vMatch.push_back(false);
2362  vHashes.push_back(hash);
2363  }
2364 
2365  txn = CPartialMerkleTree(vHashes, vMatch);
2366 }

2374 
2375 uint256 CPartialMerkleTree::CalcHash(int height, unsigned int pos, const std::vector<uint256> &vTxid) {
2376  if (height == 0) {
2377  // hash at height 0 is the txids themself
2378  return vTxid[pos];
2379  } else {
2380  // calculate left hash
2381  uint256 left = CalcHash(height-1, pos*2, vTxid), right;
2382  // calculate right hash if not beyong the end of the array - copy left hash otherwise1
2383  if (pos*2+1 < CalcTreeWidth(height-1))
2384  right = CalcHash(height-1, pos*2+1, vTxid);
2385  else
2386  right = left;
2387  // combine subhashes
2388  return Hash(BEGIN(left), END(left), BEGIN(right), END(right));
2389  }
2390 }
2391 
2392 void CPartialMerkleTree::TraverseAndBuild(int height, unsigned int pos, const std::vector<uint256> &vTxid, const std::vector<bool> &vMatch) {
2393  // determine whether this node is the parent of at least one matched txid
2394  bool fParentOfMatch = false;
2395  for (unsigned int p = pos << height; p < (pos+1) << height && p < nTransactions; p++)
2396  fParentOfMatch |= vMatch[p];
2397  // store as flag bit
2398  vBits.push_back(fParentOfMatch);
2399  if (height==0 || !fParentOfMatch) {
2400  // if at height 0, or nothing interesting below, store hash and stop
2401  vHash.push_back(CalcHash(height, pos, vTxid));
2402  } else {
2403  // otherwise, don't store any hash, but descend into the subtrees
2404  TraverseAndBuild(height-1, pos*2, vTxid, vMatch);
2405  if (pos*2+1 < CalcTreeWidth(height-1))
2406  TraverseAndBuild(height-1, pos*2+1, vTxid, vMatch);
2407  }
2408 }
2409 
2410 uint256 CPartialMerkleTree::TraverseAndExtract(int height, unsigned int pos, unsigned int &nBitsUsed, unsigned int &nHashUsed, std::vector<uint256> &vMatch) {
2411  if (nBitsUsed >= vBits.size()) {
2412  // overflowed the bits array - failure
2413  fBad = true;
2414  return 0;
2415  }
2416  bool fParentOfMatch = vBits[nBitsUsed++];
2417  if (height==0 || !fParentOfMatch) {
2418  // if at height 0, or nothing interesting below, use stored hash and do not descend
2419  if (nHashUsed >= vHash.size()) {
2420  // overflowed the hash array - failure
2421  fBad = true;
2422  return 0;
2423  }
2424  const uint256 &hash = vHash[nHashUsed++];
2425  if (height==0 && fParentOfMatch) // in case of height 0, we have a matched txid
2426  vMatch.push_back(hash);
2427  return hash;
2428  } else {
2429  // otherwise, descend into the subtrees to extract matched txids and hashes
2430  uint256 left = TraverseAndExtract(height-1, pos*2, nBitsUsed, nHashUsed, vMatch), right;
2431  if (pos*2+1 < CalcTreeWidth(height-1))
2432  right = TraverseAndExtract(height-1, pos*2+1, nBitsUsed, nHashUsed, vMatch);
2433  else
2434  right = left;
2435  // and combine them before returning
2436  return Hash(BEGIN(left), END(left), BEGIN(right), END(right));
2437  }
2438 }
2439 
2440 CPartialMerkleTree::CPartialMerkleTree(const std::vector<uint256> &vTxid, const std::vector<bool> &vMatch) : nTransactions(vTxid.size()), fBad(false) {
2441  // reset state
2442  vBits.clear();
2443  vHash.clear();
2444 
2445  // calculate height of tree
2446  int nHeight = 0;
2447  while (CalcTreeWidth(nHeight) > 1)
2448  nHeight++;
2449 
2450  // traverse the partial tree
2451  TraverseAndBuild(nHeight, 0, vTxid, vMatch);
2452 }
2453 
2454 CPartialMerkleTree::CPartialMerkleTree() : nTransactions(0), fBad(true) {}
2455 
2456 uint256 CPartialMerkleTree::ExtractMatches(std::vector<uint256> &vMatch) {
2457  vMatch.clear();
2458  // An empty set will not work
2459  if (nTransactions == 0)
2460  return 0;
2461  // check for excessively high numbers of transactions
2462  if (nTransactions > MAX_BLOCK_SIZE / 60) // 60 is the lower bound for the size of a serialized CTransaction
2463  return 0;
2464  // there can never be more hashes provided than one for every txid
2465  if (vHash.size() > nTransactions)
2466  return 0;
2467  // there must be at least one bit per node in the partial tree, and at least one node per hash
2468  if (vBits.size() < vHash.size())
2469  return 0;
2470  // calculate height of tree
2471  int nHeight = 0;
2472  while (CalcTreeWidth(nHeight) > 1)
2473  nHeight++;
2474  // traverse the partial tree
2475  unsigned int nBitsUsed = 0, nHashUsed = 0;
2476  uint256 hashMerkleRoot = TraverseAndExtract(nHeight, 0, nBitsUsed, nHashUsed, vMatch);
2477  // verify that no problems occured during the tree traversal
2478  if (fBad)
2479  return 0;
2480  // verify that all bits were consumed (except for the padding caused by serializing it as a byte sequence)
2481  if ((nBitsUsed+7)/8 != (vBits.size()+7)/8)
2482  return 0;
2483  // verify that all hashes were consumed
2484  if (nHashUsed != vHash.size())
2485  return 0;
2486  return hashMerkleRoot;
2487 }

2499  StartShutdown();
2500  return false;
2501 }

2518 FILE* OpenDiskFile(const CDiskBlockPos &pos, const char *prefix, bool fReadOnly)
2519 {
2520  if (pos.IsNull())
2521  return NULL;
2522  boost::filesystem::path path = GetDataDir() / "blocks" / strprintf("%s%05u.dat", prefix, pos.nFile);
2523  boost::filesystem::create_directories(path.parent_path());
2524  FILE* file = fopen(path.string().c_str(), "rb+");
2525  if (!file && !fReadOnly)
2526  file = fopen(path.string().c_str(), "wb+");
2527  if (!file) {
2528  printf("Unable to open file %s\n", path.string().c_str());
2529  return NULL;
2530  }
2531  if (pos.nPos) {
2532  if (fseek(file, pos.nPos, SEEK_SET)) {
2533  printf("Unable to seek to position %u of %s\n", pos.nPos, path.string().c_str());
2534  fclose(file);
2535  return NULL;
2536  }
2537  }
2538  return file;
2539 }

2549 CBlockIndex * InsertBlockIndex(uint256 hash)
2550 {
2551  if (hash == 0)
2552  return NULL;
2553 
2554  // Return existing
2555  map<uint256, CBlockIndex*>::iterator mi = mapBlockIndex.find(hash);
2556  if (mi != mapBlockIndex.end())
2557  return (*mi).second;
2558 
2559  // Create new
2560  CBlockIndex* pindexNew = new CBlockIndex();
2561  if (!pindexNew)
2562  throw runtime_error("LoadBlockIndex() : new CBlockIndex failed");
2563  mi = mapBlockIndex.insert(make_pair(hash, pindexNew)).first;
2564  pindexNew->phashBlock = &((*mi).first);
2565 
2566  return pindexNew;
2567 }
