2569 bool static LoadBlockIndexDB()
2570 {
2571  if (!pblocktree->LoadBlockIndexGuts())
2572  return false;
2573 
2574  boost::this_thread::interruption_point();
2575 
2576  // Calculate nChainWork
2577  vector<pair<int, CBlockIndex*> > vSortedByHeight;
2578  vSortedByHeight.reserve(mapBlockIndex.size());
2579  BOOST_FOREACH(const PAIRTYPE(uint256, CBlockIndex*)& item, mapBlockIndex)
2580  {
2581  CBlockIndex* pindex = item.second;
2582  vSortedByHeight.push_back(make_pair(pindex->nHeight, pindex));
2583  }
2584  sort(vSortedByHeight.begin(), vSortedByHeight.end());
2585  BOOST_FOREACH(const PAIRTYPE(int, CBlockIndex*)& item, vSortedByHeight)
2586  {
2587  CBlockIndex* pindex = item.second;
2588  pindex->nChainWork = (pindex->pprev ? pindex->pprev->nChainWork : 0) + pindex->GetBlockWork().getuint256();
2589  pindex->nChainTx = (pindex->pprev ? pindex->pprev->nChainTx : 0) + pindex->nTx;
2590  if ((pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_VALID_MASK) >= BLOCK_VALID_TRANSACTIONS && !(pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_FAILED_MASK))
2591  setBlockIndexValid.insert(pindex);
2592  }
2593 
2594  // Load block file info
2595  pblocktree->ReadLastBlockFile(nLastBlockFile);
2596  printf("LoadBlockIndexDB(): last block file = %i\n", nLastBlockFile);
2597  if (pblocktree->ReadBlockFileInfo(nLastBlockFile, infoLastBlockFile))
2598  printf("LoadBlockIndexDB(): last block file info: %s\n", infoLastBlockFile.ToString().c_str());
2599 
2600  // Load nBestInvalidWork, OK if it doesn't exist
2601  CBigNum bnBestInvalidWork;
2602  pblocktree->ReadBestInvalidWork(bnBestInvalidWork);
2603  nBestInvalidWork = bnBestInvalidWork.getuint256();
2604 
2605  // Check whether we need to continue reindexing
2606  bool fReindexing = false;
2607  pblocktree->ReadReindexing(fReindexing);
2608  fReindex |= fReindexing;
2609 
2610  // Check whether we have a transaction index
2611  pblocktree->ReadFlag("txindex", fTxIndex);
2612  printf("LoadBlockIndexDB(): transaction index %s\n", fTxIndex ? "enabled" : "disabled");
2613 
2614  // Load hashBestChain pointer to end of best chain
2615  pindexBest = pcoinsTip->GetBestBlock();
2616  if (pindexBest == NULL)
2617  return true;
2618  hashBestChain = pindexBest->GetBlockHash();
2619  nBestHeight = pindexBest->nHeight;
2620  nBestChainWork = pindexBest->nChainWork;
2621 
2622  // set 'next' pointers in best chain
2623  CBlockIndex *pindex = pindexBest;
2624  while(pindex != NULL && pindex->pprev != NULL) {
2625  CBlockIndex *pindexPrev = pindex->pprev;
2626  pindexPrev->pnext = pindex;
2627  pindex = pindexPrev;
2628  }
2629  printf("LoadBlockIndexDB(): hashBestChain=%s height=%d date=%s\n",
2630  hashBestChain.ToString().c_str(), nBestHeight,
2631  DateTimeStrFormat("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S", pindexBest->GetBlockTime()).c_str());
2632 
2633  return true;
2634 }
2635 
2636 bool VerifyDB(int nCheckLevel, int nCheckDepth)
2637 {
2638  if (pindexBest == NULL || pindexBest->pprev == NULL)
2639  return true;
2640 
2641  // Verify blocks in the best chain
2642  if (nCheckDepth <= 0)
2643  nCheckDepth = 1000000000; // suffices until the year 19000
2644  if (nCheckDepth > nBestHeight)
2645  nCheckDepth = nBestHeight;
2646  nCheckLevel = std::max(0, std::min(4, nCheckLevel));
2647  printf("Verifying last %i blocks at level %i\n", nCheckDepth, nCheckLevel);
2648  CCoinsViewCache coins(*pcoinsTip, true);
2649  CBlockIndex* pindexState = pindexBest;
2650  CBlockIndex* pindexFailure = NULL;
2651  int nGoodTransactions = 0;
2652  CValidationState state;
2653  for (CBlockIndex* pindex = pindexBest; pindex && pindex->pprev; pindex = pindex->pprev)
2654  {
2655  boost::this_thread::interruption_point();
2656  if (pindex->nHeight < nBestHeight-nCheckDepth)
2657  break;
2658  CBlock block;
2659  // check level 0: read from disk
2660  if (!block.ReadFromDisk(pindex))
2661  return error("VerifyDB() : *** block.ReadFromDisk failed at %d, hash=%s", pindex->nHeight, pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString().c_str());
2662  // check level 1: verify block validity
2663  if (nCheckLevel >= 1 && !block.CheckBlock(state))
2664  return error("VerifyDB() : *** found bad block at %d, hash=%s\n", pindex->nHeight, pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString().c_str());
2665  // check level 2: verify undo validity
2666  if (nCheckLevel >= 2 && pindex) {
2667  CBlockUndo undo;
2668  CDiskBlockPos pos = pindex->GetUndoPos();
2669  if (!pos.IsNull()) {
2670  if (!undo.ReadFromDisk(pos, pindex->pprev->GetBlockHash()))
2671  return error("VerifyDB() : *** found bad undo data at %d, hash=%s\n", pindex->nHeight, pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString().c_str());
2672  }
2673  }
2674  // check level 3: check for inconsistencies during memory-only disconnect of tip blocks
2675  if (nCheckLevel >= 3 && pindex == pindexState && (coins.GetCacheSize() + pcoinsTip->GetCacheSize()) <= 2*nCoinCacheSize + 32000) {
2676  bool fClean = true;
2677  if (!block.DisconnectBlock(state, pindex, coins, &fClean))
2678  return error("VerifyDB() : *** irrecoverable inconsistency in block data at %d, hash=%s", pindex->nHeight, pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString().c_str());
2679  pindexState = pindex->pprev;
2680  if (!fClean) {
2681  nGoodTransactions = 0;
2682  pindexFailure = pindex;
2683  } else
2684  nGoodTransactions += block.vtx.size();
2685  }
2686  }
2687  if (pindexFailure)
2688  return error("VerifyDB() : *** coin database inconsistencies found (last %i blocks, %i good transactions before that)\n", pindexBest->nHeight - pindexFailure->nHeight + 1, nGoodTransactions);
2689 
2690  // check level 4: try reconnecting blocks
2691  if (nCheckLevel >= 4) {
2692  CBlockIndex *pindex = pindexState;
2693  while (pindex != pindexBest) {
2694  boost::this_thread::interruption_point();
2695  pindex = pindex->pnext;
2696  CBlock block;
2697  if (!block.ReadFromDisk(pindex))
2698  return error("VerifyDB() : *** block.ReadFromDisk failed at %d, hash=%s", pindex->nHeight, pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString().c_str());
2699  if (!block.ConnectBlock(state, pindex, coins))
2700  return error("VerifyDB() : *** found unconnectable block at %d, hash=%s", pindex->nHeight, pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString().c_str());
2701  }
2702  }
2703 
2704  printf("No coin database inconsistencies in last %i blocks (%i transactions)\n", pindexBest->nHeight - pindexState->nHeight, nGoodTransactions);
2705 
2706  return true;
2707 }

2742 bool InitBlockIndex() {
2743  // Check whether we're already initialized
2744  if (pindexGenesisBlock != NULL)
2745  return true;
2746 
2747  // Use the provided setting for -txindex in the new database
2748  fTxIndex = GetBoolArg("-txindex", false);
2749  pblocktree->WriteFlag("txindex", fTxIndex);
2750  printf("Initializing databases...\n");
2751 
2752  // Only add the genesis block if not reindexing (in which case we reuse the one already on disk)
2753  if (!fReindex) {
2754  // Genesis Block:
2755  // CBlock(hash=12a765e31ffd4059bada, PoW=0000050c34a64b415b6b, ver=1, hashPrevBlock=00000000000000000000, hashMerkleRoot=97ddfbbae6, nTime=1317972665, nBits=1e0ffff0, nNonce=2084524493, vtx=1)
2756  // CTransaction(hash=97ddfbbae6, ver=1, vin.size=1, vout.size=1, nLockTime=0)

2760

2763 
2764  // Czarcoin Testnet Genesis Block
2765  // block.nTime = 1413169260
2766  // block.nNonce = 386799647
2767  // block.GetHash = bb43407716677ded9c2c32cf82ecb3c26b2d24a552dbcb4d53257a9f4b32178a
2768  // CBlock(hash=bb43407716677ded9c2c, PoW=000001e2a3db10347709, ver=1, hashPrevBlock=00000000000000000000, hashMerkleRoot=adc2a5fbf9, nTime=1413169260, nBits=1e0ffff0, nNonce=386799647, vtx=1)
2769  // CTransaction(hash=adc2a5fbf9, ver=1, vin.size=1, vout.size=1, nLockTime=0)
2770  // CTxIn(COutPoint(0000000000, -1), coinbase 04ffff001d01043e2e2e2e696e206c69676874206f6620616c6c2074686174206861732068617070656e65642c206f6e6c79206f6e6520666163746f722072656d61696e733a)
2771  // CTxOut(nValue=99.00000000, scriptPubKey=040184710fa689ad5023690c80f3a4)
2772  // vMerkleTree: adc2a5fbf9
2773 
2774  // Czarcoin Twin Genesis Block
2775  // block.nTime = 1413169227
2776  // block.nNonce = 2084732958
2777  // block.GetHash = 26386e3d1dfe042576122eef381d662551f33d68eb29e3a3fb5fd0cd5f25788e
2778  // CBlock(hash=26386e3d1dfe04257612, PoW=00000372a7895841fc26, ver=1, hashPrevBlock=00000000000000000000, hashMerkleRoot=adc2a5fbf9, nTime=1413169227, nBits=1e0ffff0, nNonce=2084732958, vtx=1)
2779  // CTransaction(hash=adc2a5fbf9, ver=1, vin.size=1, vout.size=1, nLockTime=0)

2781  // CTxOut(nValue=99.00000000, scriptPubKey=040184710fa689ad5023690c80f3a4)
2782  // vMerkleTree: adc2a5fbf9

2790  txNew.vout[0].nValue = 99 * COIN;
2791  txNew.vout[0].scriptPubKey = CScript() << ParseHex("040184710fa689ad5023690c80f3a49c8f13f8d45b8c857fbcbc8bc4a8e4d3eb4b10f4d4604fa08dce601aaf0f470216fe1b51850b4acf21b179c45070ac7b03a9") << OP_CHECKSIG;

2796  block.nVersion = 1;
2797  block.nTime = 1413169227;
2798  block.nBits = 0x1e0ffff0;
2799  block.nNonce = 2084732958;
2800

2802  {
2803  block.nTime = 1413169260;
2804  block.nNonce = 386799647;

2812  assert(block.hashMerkleRoot == uint256("0xadc2a5fbf9b0d5ab9b34fadc992d0d3666907743147b4db694b4218cee5eda13"));

2819  CDiskBlockPos blockPos;
2820  CValidationState state;
2821  if (!FindBlockPos(state, blockPos, nBlockSize+8, 0, block.nTime))
2822  return error("LoadBlockIndex() : FindBlockPos failed");
2823  if (!block.WriteToDisk(blockPos))
2824  return error("LoadBlockIndex() : writing genesis block to disk failed");
2825  if (!block.AddToBlockIndex(state, blockPos))
2826  return error("LoadBlockIndex() : genesis block not accepted");
2827  } catch(std::runtime_error &e) {
2828  return error("LoadBlockIndex() : failed to initialize block database: %s", e.what());
2829  }
2830  }
2831 
2832  return true;
2833 }

2837 void PrintBlockTree()
2838 {
2839  // pre-compute tree structure
2840  map<CBlockIndex*, vector<CBlockIndex*> > mapNext;
2841  for (map<uint256, CBlockIndex*>::iterator mi = mapBlockIndex.begin(); mi != mapBlockIndex.end(); ++mi)
2842  {
2843  CBlockIndex* pindex = (*mi).second;
2844  mapNext[pindex->pprev].push_back(pindex);
2845  // test
2846  //while (rand() % 3 == 0)
2847  // mapNext[pindex->pprev].push_back(pindex);
2848  }
2849 
2850  vector<pair<int, CBlockIndex*> > vStack;
2851  vStack.push_back(make_pair(0, pindexGenesisBlock));
2852 
2853  int nPrevCol = 0;
2854  while (!vStack.empty())
2855  {
2856  int nCol = vStack.back().first;
2857  CBlockIndex* pindex = vStack.back().second;
2858  vStack.pop_back();
2859 
2860  // print split or gap
2861  if (nCol > nPrevCol)
2862  {
2863  for (int i = 0; i < nCol-1; i++)
2864  printf("| ");
2865  printf("|\\\n");
2866  }
2867  else if (nCol < nPrevCol)
2868  {
2869  for (int i = 0; i < nCol; i++)
2870  printf("| ");
2871  printf("|\n");
2872  }
2873  nPrevCol = nCol;
2874 
2875  // print columns
2876  for (int i = 0; i < nCol; i++)
2877  printf("| ");
2878 
2879  // print item
2880  CBlock block;
2881  block.ReadFromDisk(pindex);
2882  printf("%d (blk%05u.dat:0x%x) %s tx %"PRIszu"",
2883  pindex->nHeight,
2884  pindex->GetBlockPos().nFile, pindex->GetBlockPos().nPos,
2885  DateTimeStrFormat("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S", block.GetBlockTime()).c_str(),
2886  block.vtx.size());
2887 
2888  PrintWallets(block);
2889 
2890  // put the main time-chain first
2891  vector<CBlockIndex*>& vNext = mapNext[pindex];
2892  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < vNext.size(); i++)
2893  {
2894  if (vNext[i]->pnext)
2895  {
2896  swap(vNext[0], vNext[i]);
2897  break;
2898  }
2899  }
2900 
2901  // iterate children
2902  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < vNext.size(); i++)
2903  vStack.push_back(make_pair(nCol+i, vNext[i]));
2904  }
2905 }

2907 bool LoadExternalBlockFile(FILE* fileIn, CDiskBlockPos *dbp)
2908 {
2909  int64 nStart = GetTimeMillis();
2910 
2911  int nLoaded = 0;
2912  try {
2913  CBufferedFile blkdat(fileIn, 2*MAX_BLOCK_SIZE, MAX_BLOCK_SIZE+8, SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION);
2914  uint64 nStartByte = 0;
2915  if (dbp) {
2916  // (try to) skip already indexed part
2917  CBlockFileInfo info;
2918  if (pblocktree->ReadBlockFileInfo(dbp->nFile, info)) {
2919  nStartByte = info.nSize;
2920  blkdat.Seek(info.nSize);
2921  }
2922  }
2923  uint64 nRewind = blkdat.GetPos();
2924  while (blkdat.good() && !blkdat.eof()) {
2925  boost::this_thread::interruption_point();
2926 
2927  blkdat.SetPos(nRewind);
2928  nRewind++; // start one byte further next time, in case of failure
2929  blkdat.SetLimit(); // remove former limit
2930  unsigned int nSize = 0;
2931  try {
2932  // locate a header
2933  unsigned char buf[4];
2934  blkdat.FindByte(pchMessageStart[0]);
2935  nRewind = blkdat.GetPos()+1;
2936  blkdat >> FLATDATA(buf);
2937  if (memcmp(buf, pchMessageStart, 4))
2938  continue;
2939  // read size
2940  blkdat >> nSize;
2941  if (nSize < 80 || nSize > MAX_BLOCK_SIZE)
2942  continue;
2943  } catch (std::exception &e) {
2944  // no valid block header found; don't complain
2945  break;
2946  }
2947  try {
2948  // read block
2949  uint64 nBlockPos = blkdat.GetPos();
2950  blkdat.SetLimit(nBlockPos + nSize);
2951  CBlock block;
2952  blkdat >> block;
2953  nRewind = blkdat.GetPos();
2954 
2955  // process block
2956  if (nBlockPos >= nStartByte) {
2957  LOCK(cs_main);
2958  if (dbp)
2959  dbp->nPos = nBlockPos;
2960  CValidationState state;
2961  if (ProcessBlock(state, NULL, &block, dbp))
2962  nLoaded++;
2963  if (state.IsError())
2964  break;
2965  }
2966  } catch (std::exception &e) {
2967  printf("%s() : Deserialize or I/O error caught during load\n", __PRETTY_FUNCTION__);
2968  }
2969  }
2970  fclose(fileIn);
2971  } catch(std::runtime_error &e) {
2972  AbortNode(_("Error: system error: ") + e.what());
2973  }
2974  if (nLoaded > 0)
2975  printf("Loaded %i blocks from external file in %"PRI64d"ms\n", nLoaded, GetTimeMillis() - nStart);
2976  return nLoaded > 0;
2977 }

3017  {

3032  }

3037  return strStatusBar;

3057 bool static AlreadyHave(const CInv& inv)
3058 {
3059  switch (inv.type)
3060  {
3061  case MSG_TX:
3062  {
3063  bool txInMap = false;
3064  {
3065  LOCK(mempool.cs);
3066  txInMap = mempool.exists(inv.hash);
3067  }
3068  return txInMap || mapOrphanTransactions.count(inv.hash) ||
3069  pcoinsTip->HaveCoins(inv.hash);
3070  }
3071  case MSG_BLOCK:
3072  return mapBlockIndex.count(inv.hash) ||
3073  mapOrphanBlocks.count(inv.hash);
3074  }
3075  // Don't know what it is, just say we already got one
3076  return true;
3077 }
3078 
3079 
3080 
3081 
3082 // The message start string is designed to be unlikely to occur in normal data.
3083 // The characters are rarely used upper ASCII, not valid as UTF-8, and produce
3084 // a large 4-byte int at any alignment.
3085 unsigned char pchMessageStart[4] = { 0x63, 0x7a, 0x61, 0x72 }; // Czarcoin: czar
3086

3088 void static ProcessGetData(CNode* pfrom)
3089 {
3090  std::deque<CInv>::iterator it = pfrom->vRecvGetData.begin();
3091 
3092  vector<CInv> vNotFound;
3093 
3094  while (it != pfrom->vRecvGetData.end()) {
3095  // Don't bother if send buffer is too full to respond anyway
3096  if (pfrom->nSendSize >= SendBufferSize())
3097  break;
3098 
3099  // Don't waste work on slow peers until they catch up on the blocks we
3100  // give them. 80 bytes is just the size of a block header - obviously
3101  // the minimum we might return.
3102  if (pfrom->nBlocksRequested * 80 > pfrom->nSendBytes)
3103  break;
3104 
3105  const CInv &inv = *it;
3106  {
3107  boost::this_thread::interruption_point();
3108  it++;
3109 
3110  if (inv.type == MSG_BLOCK || inv.type == MSG_FILTERED_BLOCK)
3111  {
3112  bool send = true;
3113  map<uint256, CBlockIndex*>::iterator mi = mapBlockIndex.find(inv.hash);
3114  pfrom->nBlocksRequested++;
3115  if (mi != mapBlockIndex.end())
3116  {
3117  // If the requested block is at a height below our last
3118  // checkpoint, only serve it if it's in the checkpointed chain
3119  int nHeight = ((*mi).second)->nHeight;
3120  CBlockIndex* pcheckpoint = Checkpoints::GetLastCheckpoint(mapBlockIndex);
3121  if (pcheckpoint && nHeight < pcheckpoint->nHeight) {
3122  if (!((*mi).second)->IsInMainChain())
3123  {
3124  printf("ProcessGetData(): ignoring request for old block that isn't in the main chain\n");
3125  send = false;
3126  }
3127  }
3128  } else {
3129  send = false;
3130  }
3131  if (send)
3132  {
3133  // Send block from disk
3134  CBlock block;
3135  block.ReadFromDisk((*mi).second);
3136  if (inv.type == MSG_BLOCK)
3137  pfrom->PushMessage("block", block);
3138  else // MSG_FILTERED_BLOCK)
3139  {
3140  LOCK(pfrom->cs_filter);
3141  if (pfrom->pfilter)
3142  {
3143  CMerkleBlock merkleBlock(block, *pfrom->pfilter);
3144  pfrom->PushMessage("merkleblock", merkleBlock);
3145  // CMerkleBlock just contains hashes, so also push any transactions in the block the client did not see
3146  // This avoids hurting performance by pointlessly requiring a round-trip
3147  // Note that there is currently no way for a node to request any single transactions we didnt send here -
3148  // they must either disconnect and retry or request the full block.
3149  // Thus, the protocol spec specified allows for us to provide duplicate txn here,
3150  // however we MUST always provide at least what the remote peer needs
3151  typedef std::pair<unsigned int, uint256> PairType;
3152  BOOST_FOREACH(PairType& pair, merkleBlock.vMatchedTxn)
3153  if (!pfrom->setInventoryKnown.count(CInv(MSG_TX, pair.second)))
3154  pfrom->PushMessage("tx", block.vtx[pair.first]);
3155  }
3156  // else
3157  // no response
3158  }
3159 
3160  // Trigger them to send a getblocks request for the next batch of inventory
3161  if (inv.hash == pfrom->hashContinue)
3162  {
3163  // Bypass PushInventory, this must send even if redundant,
3164  // and we want it right after the last block so they don't
3165  // wait for other stuff first.
3166  vector<CInv> vInv;
3167  vInv.push_back(CInv(MSG_BLOCK, hashBestChain));
3168  pfrom->PushMessage("inv", vInv);
3169  pfrom->hashContinue = 0;
3170  }
3171  }
3172  }
3173  else if (inv.IsKnownType())
3174  {
3175  // Send stream from relay memory
3176  bool pushed = false;
3177  {
3178  LOCK(cs_mapRelay);
3179  map<CInv, CDataStream>::iterator mi = mapRelay.find(inv);
3180  if (mi != mapRelay.end()) {
3181  pfrom->PushMessage(inv.GetCommand(), (*mi).second);
3182  pushed = true;
3183  }
3184  }
3185  if (!pushed && inv.type == MSG_TX) {
3186  LOCK(mempool.cs);
3187  if (mempool.exists(inv.hash)) {
3188  CTransaction tx = mempool.lookup(inv.hash);
3189  CDataStream ss(SER_NETWORK, PROTOCOL_VERSION);
3190  ss.reserve(1000);
3191  ss << tx;
3192  pfrom->PushMessage("tx", ss);
3193  pushed = true;
3194  }
3195  }
3196  if (!pushed) {
3197  vNotFound.push_back(inv);
3198  }
3199  }
3200 
3201  // Track requests for our stuff.
3202  Inventory(inv.hash);
3203 
3204  if (inv.type == MSG_BLOCK || inv.type == MSG_FILTERED_BLOCK)
3205  break;
3206  }
3207  }
3208 
3209  pfrom->vRecvGetData.erase(pfrom->vRecvGetData.begin(), it);
3210 
3211  if (!vNotFound.empty()) {
3212  // Let the peer know that we didn't find what it asked for, so it doesn't
3213  // have to wait around forever. Currently only SPV clients actually care
3214  // about this message: it's needed when they are recursively walking the
3215  // dependencies of relevant unconfirmed transactions. SPV clients want to
3216  // do that because they want to know about (and store and rebroadcast and
3217  // risk analyze) the dependencies of transactions relevant to them, without
3218  // having to download the entire memory pool.
3219  pfrom->PushMessage("notfound", vNotFound);
3220  }
3221 }
3222 
3223 bool static ProcessMessage(CNode* pfrom, string strCommand, CDataStream& vRecv)
3224 {
3225  RandAddSeedPerfmon();
3226  if (fDebug)
3227  printf("received: %s (%"PRIszu" bytes)\n", strCommand.c_str(), vRecv.size());
3228  if (mapArgs.count("-dropmessagestest") && GetRand(atoi(mapArgs["-dropmessagestest"])) == 0)
3229  {
3230  printf("dropmessagestest DROPPING RECV MESSAGE\n");
3231  return true;
3232  }
3233 
3234 
3235 
3236 
3237 
3238  if (strCommand == "version")
3239  {
3240  // Each connection can only send one version message
3241  if (pfrom->nVersion != 0)
3242  {
3243  pfrom->Misbehaving(1);
3244  return false;
3245  }
3246 
3247  int64 nTime;
3248  CAddress addrMe;
3249  CAddress addrFrom;
3250  uint64 nNonce = 1;
3251  vRecv >> pfrom->nVersion >> pfrom->nServices >> nTime >> addrMe;
3252  if (pfrom->nVersion < MIN_PEER_PROTO_VERSION)
3253  {
3254  // disconnect from peers older than this proto version
3255  printf("partner %s using obsolete version %i; disconnecting\n", pfrom->addr.ToString().c_str(), pfrom->nVersion);
3256  pfrom->fDisconnect = true;
3257  return false;
3258  }
3259 
3260  if (pfrom->nVersion == 10300)
3261  pfrom->nVersion = 300;
3262  if (!vRecv.empty())
3263  vRecv >> addrFrom >> nNonce;
3264  if (!vRecv.empty()) {
3265  vRecv >> pfrom->strSubVer;
3266  pfrom->cleanSubVer = SanitizeString(pfrom->strSubVer);
3267  }
3268  if (!vRecv.empty())
3269  vRecv >> pfrom->nStartingHeight;
3270  if (!vRecv.empty())
3271  vRecv >> pfrom->fRelayTxes; // set to true after we get the first filter* message
3272  else
3273  pfrom->fRelayTxes = true;
3274 
3275  if (pfrom->fInbound && addrMe.IsRoutable())
3276  {
3277  pfrom->addrLocal = addrMe;
3278  SeenLocal(addrMe);
3279  }
3280 
3281  // Disconnect if we connected to ourself
3282  if (nNonce == nLocalHostNonce && nNonce > 1)
3283  {
3284  printf("connected to self at %s, disconnecting\n", pfrom->addr.ToString().c_str());
3285  pfrom->fDisconnect = true;
3286  return true;
3287  }
3288 
3289  // Be shy and don't send version until we hear
3290  if (pfrom->fInbound)
3291  pfrom->PushVersion();
3292 
3293  pfrom->fClient = !(pfrom->nServices & NODE_NETWORK);
3294 
3295  AddTimeData(pfrom->addr, nTime);
3296 
3297  // Change version
3298  pfrom->PushMessage("verack");
3299  pfrom->ssSend.SetVersion(min(pfrom->nVersion, PROTOCOL_VERSION));
3300 
3301  if (!pfrom->fInbound)
3302  {
3303  // Advertise our address
3304  if (!fNoListen && !IsInitialBlockDownload())
3305  {
3306  CAddress addr = GetLocalAddress(&pfrom->addr);
3307  if (addr.IsRoutable())
3308  pfrom->PushAddress(addr);
3309  }
3310 
3311  // Get recent addresses
3312  if (pfrom->fOneShot || pfrom->nVersion >= CADDR_TIME_VERSION || addrman.size() < 1000)
3313  {
3314  pfrom->PushMessage("getaddr");
3315  pfrom->fGetAddr = true;
3316  }
3317  addrman.Good(pfrom->addr);
3318  } else {
3319  if (((CNetAddr)pfrom->addr) == (CNetAddr)addrFrom)
3320  {
3321  addrman.Add(addrFrom, addrFrom);
3322  addrman.Good(addrFrom);
3323  }
3324  }
3325 
3326  // Relay alerts
3327  {
3328  LOCK(cs_mapAlerts);
3329  BOOST_FOREACH(PAIRTYPE(const uint256, CAlert)& item, mapAlerts)
3330  item.second.RelayTo(pfrom);
3331  }
3332 
3333  pfrom->fSuccessfullyConnected = true;
3334 
3335  printf("receive version message: %s: version %d, blocks=%d, us=%s, them=%s, peer=%s\n", pfrom->cleanSubVer.c_str(), pfrom->nVersion, pfrom->nStartingHeight, addrMe.ToString().c_str(), addrFrom.ToString().c_str(), pfrom->addr.ToString().c_str());
3336 
3337  cPeerBlockCounts.input(pfrom->nStartingHeight);
3338  }
3339 
3340 
3341  else if (pfrom->nVersion == 0)
3342  {
3343  // Must have a version message before anything else
3344  pfrom->Misbehaving(1);
3345  return false;
3346  }
3347 
3348 
3349  else if (strCommand == "verack")
3350  {
3351  pfrom->SetRecvVersion(min(pfrom->nVersion, PROTOCOL_VERSION));
3352  }
3353 
3354 
3355  else if (strCommand == "addr")
3356  {
3357  vector<CAddress> vAddr;
3358  vRecv >> vAddr;
3359 
3360  // Don't want addr from older versions unless seeding
3361  if (pfrom->nVersion < CADDR_TIME_VERSION && addrman.size() > 1000)
3362  return true;
3363  if (vAddr.size() > 1000)
3364  {
3365  pfrom->Misbehaving(20);
3366  return error("message addr size() = %"PRIszu"", vAddr.size());
3367  }
3368 
3369  // Store the new addresses
3370  vector<CAddress> vAddrOk;
3371  int64 nNow = GetAdjustedTime();
3372  int64 nSince = nNow - 10 * 60;
3373  BOOST_FOREACH(CAddress& addr, vAddr)
3374  {
3375  boost::this_thread::interruption_point();
3376 
3377  if (addr.nTime <= 100000000 || addr.nTime > nNow + 10 * 60)
3378  addr.nTime = nNow - 5 * 24 * 60 * 60;
3379  pfrom->AddAddressKnown(addr);
3380  bool fReachable = IsReachable(addr);
3381  if (addr.nTime > nSince && !pfrom->fGetAddr && vAddr.size() <= 10 && addr.IsRoutable())
3382  {
3383  // Relay to a limited number of other nodes
3384  {
3385  LOCK(cs_vNodes);
3386  // Use deterministic randomness to send to the same nodes for 24 hours
3387  // at a time so the setAddrKnowns of the chosen nodes prevent repeats
3388  static uint256 hashSalt;
3389  if (hashSalt == 0)
3390  hashSalt = GetRandHash();
3391  uint64 hashAddr = addr.GetHash();
3392  uint256 hashRand = hashSalt ^ (hashAddr<<32) ^ ((GetTime()+hashAddr)/(24*60*60));
3393  hashRand = Hash(BEGIN(hashRand), END(hashRand));
3394  multimap<uint256, CNode*> mapMix;
3395  BOOST_FOREACH(CNode* pnode, vNodes)
3396  {
3397  if (pnode->nVersion < CADDR_TIME_VERSION)
3398  continue;
3399  unsigned int nPointer;
3400  memcpy(&nPointer, &pnode, sizeof(nPointer));
3401  uint256 hashKey = hashRand ^ nPointer;
3402  hashKey = Hash(BEGIN(hashKey), END(hashKey));
3403  mapMix.insert(make_pair(hashKey, pnode));
3404  }
3405  int nRelayNodes = fReachable ? 2 : 1; // limited relaying of addresses outside our network(s)
3406  for (multimap<uint256, CNode*>::iterator mi = mapMix.begin(); mi != mapMix.end() && nRelayNodes-- > 0; ++mi)
3407  ((*mi).second)->PushAddress(addr);
3408  }
3409  }
3410  // Do not store addresses outside our network
3411  if (fReachable)
3412  vAddrOk.push_back(addr);
3413  }
3414  addrman.Add(vAddrOk, pfrom->addr, 2 * 60 * 60);
3415  if (vAddr.size() < 1000)
3416  pfrom->fGetAddr = false;
3417  if (pfrom->fOneShot)
3418  pfrom->fDisconnect = true;
3419  }
3420 
3421 
3422  else if (strCommand == "inv")
3423  {
3424  vector<CInv> vInv;
3425  vRecv >> vInv;
3426  if (vInv.size() > MAX_INV_SZ)
3427  {
3428  pfrom->Misbehaving(20);
3429  return error("message inv size() = %"PRIszu"", vInv.size());
3430  }
3431 
3432  // find last block in inv vector
3433  unsigned int nLastBlock = (unsigned int)(-1);
3434  for (unsigned int nInv = 0; nInv < vInv.size(); nInv++) {
3435  if (vInv[vInv.size() - 1 - nInv].type == MSG_BLOCK) {
3436  nLastBlock = vInv.size() - 1 - nInv;
3437  break;
3438  }
3439  }
3440  for (unsigned int nInv = 0; nInv < vInv.size(); nInv++)
3441  {
3442  const CInv &inv = vInv[nInv];
3443 
3444  boost::this_thread::interruption_point();
3445  pfrom->AddInventoryKnown(inv);
3446 
3447  bool fAlreadyHave = AlreadyHave(inv);
3448  if (fDebug)
3449  printf(" got inventory: %s %s\n", inv.ToString().c_str(), fAlreadyHave ? "have" : "new");
3450 
3451  if (!fAlreadyHave) {
3452  if (!fImporting && !fReindex)
3453  pfrom->AskFor(inv);
3454  } else if (inv.type == MSG_BLOCK && mapOrphanBlocks.count(inv.hash)) {
3455  pfrom->PushGetBlocks(pindexBest, GetOrphanRoot(mapOrphanBlocks[inv.hash]));
3456  } else if (nInv == nLastBlock) {
3457  // In case we are on a very long side-chain, it is possible that we already have
3458  // the last block in an inv bundle sent in response to getblocks. Try to detect
3459  // this situation and push another getblocks to continue.
3460  pfrom->PushGetBlocks(mapBlockIndex[inv.hash], uint256(0));
3461  if (fDebug)
3462  printf("force request: %s\n", inv.ToString().c_str());
3463  }
3464 
3465  // Track requests for our stuff
3466  Inventory(inv.hash);
3467  }
3468  }
3469 
3470 
3471  else if (strCommand == "getdata")
3472  {
3473  vector<CInv> vInv;
3474  vRecv >> vInv;
3475  if (vInv.size() > MAX_INV_SZ)
3476  {
3477  pfrom->Misbehaving(20);
3478  return error("message getdata size() = %"PRIszu"", vInv.size());
3479  }
3480 
3481  if (fDebugNet || (vInv.size() != 1))
3482  printf("received getdata (%"PRIszu" invsz)\n", vInv.size());
3483 
3484  if ((fDebugNet && vInv.size() > 0) || (vInv.size() == 1))
3485  printf("received getdata for: %s\n", vInv[0].ToString().c_str());
3486 
3487  pfrom->vRecvGetData.insert(pfrom->vRecvGetData.end(), vInv.begin(), vInv.end());
3488  ProcessGetData(pfrom);
3489  }
3490 
3491 
3492  else if (strCommand == "getblocks")
3493  {
3494  CBlockLocator locator;
3495  uint256 hashStop;
3496  vRecv >> locator >> hashStop;
3497 
3498  // Find the last block the caller has in the main chain
3499  CBlockIndex* pindex = locator.GetBlockIndex();
3500 
3501  // Send the rest of the chain
3502  if (pindex)
3503  pindex = pindex->pnext;
3504  int nLimit = 500;
3505  printf("getblocks %d to %s limit %d\n", (pindex ? pindex->nHeight : -1), hashStop.ToString().c_str(), nLimit);
3506  for (; pindex; pindex = pindex->pnext)
3507  {
3508  if (pindex->GetBlockHash() == hashStop)
3509  {
3510  printf(" getblocks stopping at %d %s\n", pindex->nHeight, pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString().c_str());
3511  break;
3512  }
3513  pfrom->PushInventory(CInv(MSG_BLOCK, pindex->GetBlockHash()));
3514  if (--nLimit <= 0)
3515  {
3516  // When this block is requested, we'll send an inv that'll make them
3517  // getblocks the next batch of inventory.
3518  printf(" getblocks stopping at limit %d %s\n", pindex->nHeight, pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString().c_str());
3519  pfrom->hashContinue = pindex->GetBlockHash();
3520  break;
3521  }
3522  }
3523  }

3525 
3526  else if (strCommand == "getheaders")
3527  {
3528  CBlockLocator locator;
3529  uint256 hashStop;
3530  vRecv >> locator >> hashStop;
3531 
3532  CBlockIndex* pindex = NULL;
3533  if (locator.IsNull())
3534  {
3535  // If locator is null, return the hashStop block
3536  map<uint256, CBlockIndex*>::iterator mi = mapBlockIndex.find(hashStop);
3537  if (mi == mapBlockIndex.end())
3538  return true;
3539  pindex = (*mi).second;
3540  }
3541  else
3542  {
3543  // Find the last block the caller has in the main chain
3544  pindex = locator.GetBlockIndex();
3545  if (pindex)
3546  pindex = pindex->pnext;
3547  }
3548 
3549  // we must use CBlocks, as CBlockHeaders won't include the 0x00 nTx count at the end
3550  vector<CBlock> vHeaders;
3551  int nLimit = 2000;
3552  printf("getheaders %d to %s\n", (pindex ? pindex->nHeight : -1), hashStop.ToString().c_str());
3553  for (; pindex; pindex = pindex->pnext)
3554  {
3555  vHeaders.push_back(pindex->GetBlockHeader());
3556  if (--nLimit <= 0 || pindex->GetBlockHash() == hashStop)
3557  break;
3558  }
3559  pfrom->PushMessage("headers", vHeaders);
3560  }
3561 
3562 
3563  else if (strCommand == "tx")
3564  {
3565  vector<uint256> vWorkQueue;
3566  vector<uint256> vEraseQueue;
3567  CDataStream vMsg(vRecv);
3568  CTransaction tx;
3569  vRecv >> tx;
3570 
3571  CInv inv(MSG_TX, tx.GetHash());
3572  pfrom->AddInventoryKnown(inv);
3573 
3574  bool fMissingInputs = false;
3575  CValidationState state;
3576  if (tx.AcceptToMemoryPool(state, true, true, &fMissingInputs))
3577  {
3578  RelayTransaction(tx, inv.hash);
3579  mapAlreadyAskedFor.erase(inv);
3580  vWorkQueue.push_back(inv.hash);
3581  vEraseQueue.push_back(inv.hash);
3582 
3583  printf("AcceptToMemoryPool: %s %s : accepted %s (poolsz %"PRIszu")\n",
3584  pfrom->addr.ToString().c_str(), pfrom->cleanSubVer.c_str(),
3585  tx.GetHash().ToString().c_str(),
3586  mempool.mapTx.size());
3587 
3588  // Recursively process any orphan transactions that depended on this one
3589  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < vWorkQueue.size(); i++)
3590  {
3591  uint256 hashPrev = vWorkQueue[i];
3592  for (set<uint256>::iterator mi = mapOrphanTransactionsByPrev[hashPrev].begin();
3593  mi != mapOrphanTransactionsByPrev[hashPrev].end();
3594  ++mi)
3595  {
3596  const uint256& orphanHash = *mi;
3597  const CTransaction& orphanTx = mapOrphanTransactions[orphanHash];
3598  bool fMissingInputs2 = false;
3599  // Use a dummy CValidationState so someone can't setup nodes to counter-DoS based on orphan
3600  // resolution (that is, feeding people an invalid transaction based on LegitTxX in order to get
3601  // anyone relaying LegitTxX banned)
3602  CValidationState stateDummy;
3603 
3604  if (tx.AcceptToMemoryPool(stateDummy, true, true, &fMissingInputs2))
3605  {
3606  printf(" accepted orphan tx %s\n", orphanHash.ToString().c_str());
3607  RelayTransaction(orphanTx, orphanHash);
3608  mapAlreadyAskedFor.erase(CInv(MSG_TX, orphanHash));
3609  vWorkQueue.push_back(orphanHash);
3610  vEraseQueue.push_back(orphanHash);
3611  }
3612  else if (!fMissingInputs2)
3613  {
3614  // invalid or too-little-fee orphan
3615  vEraseQueue.push_back(orphanHash);
3616  printf(" removed orphan tx %s\n", orphanHash.ToString().c_str());
3617  }
3618  }
3619  }
3620 
3621  BOOST_FOREACH(uint256 hash, vEraseQueue)
3622  EraseOrphanTx(hash);
3623  }
3624  else if (fMissingInputs)
3625  {
3626  AddOrphanTx(tx);
3627 
3628  // DoS prevention: do not allow mapOrphanTransactions to grow unbounded
3629  unsigned int nEvicted = LimitOrphanTxSize(MAX_ORPHAN_TRANSACTIONS);
3630  if (nEvicted > 0)
3631  printf("mapOrphan overflow, removed %u tx\n", nEvicted);
3632  }
3633  int nDoS = 0;
3634  if (state.IsInvalid(nDoS))
3635  {
3636  printf("%s from %s %s was not accepted into the memory pool\n", tx.GetHash().ToString().c_str(),
3637  pfrom->addr.ToString().c_str(), pfrom->cleanSubVer.c_str());
3638  if (nDoS > 0)
3639  pfrom->Misbehaving(nDoS);
3640  }
3641  }
3642 
3643 
3644  else if (strCommand == "block" && !fImporting && !fReindex) // Ignore blocks received while importing
3645  {
3646  CBlock block;
3647  vRecv >> block;
3648 
3649  printf("received block %s\n", block.GetHash().ToString().c_str());
3650  // block.print();
3651 
3652  CInv inv(MSG_BLOCK, block.GetHash());
3653  pfrom->AddInventoryKnown(inv);
3654 
3655  CValidationState state;
3656  if (ProcessBlock(state, pfrom, &block) || state.CorruptionPossible())
3657  mapAlreadyAskedFor.erase(inv);
3658  int nDoS = 0;
3659  if (state.IsInvalid(nDoS))
3660  if (nDoS > 0)
3661  pfrom->Misbehaving(nDoS);
3662  }
3663 
3664 
3665  else if (strCommand == "getaddr")
3666  {
3667  pfrom->vAddrToSend.clear();
3668  vector<CAddress> vAddr = addrman.GetAddr();
3669  BOOST_FOREACH(const CAddress &addr, vAddr)
3670  pfrom->PushAddress(addr);
3671  }
3672 
3673 
3674  else if (strCommand == "mempool")
3675  {
3676  std::vector<uint256> vtxid;
3677  LOCK2(mempool.cs, pfrom->cs_filter);
3678  mempool.queryHashes(vtxid);
3679  vector<CInv> vInv;
3680  BOOST_FOREACH(uint256& hash, vtxid) {
3681  CInv inv(MSG_TX, hash);
3682  if ((pfrom->pfilter && pfrom->pfilter->IsRelevantAndUpdate(mempool.lookup(hash), hash)) ||
3683  (!pfrom->pfilter))
3684  vInv.push_back(inv);
3685  if (vInv.size() == MAX_INV_SZ)
3686  break;
3687  }
3688  if (vInv.size() > 0)
3689  pfrom->PushMessage("inv", vInv);
3690  }
3691 
3692 
3693  else if (strCommand == "ping")
3694  {
3695  if (pfrom->nVersion > BIP0031_VERSION)
3696  {
3697  uint64 nonce = 0;
3698  vRecv >> nonce;
3699  // Echo the message back with the nonce. This allows for two useful features:
3700  //
3701  // 1) A remote node can quickly check if the connection is operational
3702  // 2) Remote nodes can measure the latency of the network thread. If this node
3703  // is overloaded it won't respond to pings quickly and the remote node can
3704  // avoid sending us more work, like chain download requests.
3705  //
3706  // The nonce stops the remote getting confused between different pings: without
3707  // it, if the remote node sends a ping once per second and this node takes 5
3708  // seconds to respond to each, the 5th ping the remote sends would appear to
3709  // return very quickly.
3710  pfrom->PushMessage("pong", nonce);
3711  }
3712  }
3713 
3714 
3715  else if (strCommand == "alert")
3716  {
3717  CAlert alert;
3718  vRecv >> alert;
3719 
3720  uint256 alertHash = alert.GetHash();
3721  if (pfrom->setKnown.count(alertHash) == 0)
3722  {
3723  if (alert.ProcessAlert())
3724  {
3725  // Relay
3726  pfrom->setKnown.insert(alertHash);
3727  {
3728  LOCK(cs_vNodes);
3729  BOOST_FOREACH(CNode* pnode, vNodes)
3730  alert.RelayTo(pnode);
3731  }
3732  }
3733  else {
3734  // Small DoS penalty so peers that send us lots of
3735  // duplicate/expired/invalid-signature/whatever alerts
3736  // eventually get banned.
3737  // This isn't a Misbehaving(100) (immediate ban) because the
3738  // peer might be an older or different implementation with
3739  // a different signature key, etc.
3740  pfrom->Misbehaving(10);
3741  }
3742  }
3743  }
3744 
3745 
3746  else if (!fBloomFilters &&
3747  (strCommand == "filterload" ||
3748  strCommand == "filteradd" ||
3749  strCommand == "filterclear"))
3750  {
3751  pfrom->CloseSocketDisconnect();
3752  return error("peer %s attempted to set a bloom filter even though we do not advertise that service",
3753  pfrom->addr.ToString().c_str());
3754  }
3755 
3756  else if (strCommand == "filterload")
3757  {
3758  CBloomFilter filter;
3759  vRecv >> filter;
3760 
3761  if (!filter.IsWithinSizeConstraints())
3762  // There is no excuse for sending a too-large filter
3763  pfrom->Misbehaving(100);
3764  else
3765  {
3766  LOCK(pfrom->cs_filter);
3767  delete pfrom->pfilter;
3768  pfrom->pfilter = new CBloomFilter(filter);
3769  pfrom->pfilter->UpdateEmptyFull();
3770  }
3771  pfrom->fRelayTxes = true;
3772  }
3773 
3774 
3775  else if (strCommand == "filteradd")
3776  {
3777  vector<unsigned char> vData;
3778  vRecv >> vData;
3779 
3780  // Nodes must NEVER send a data item > 520 bytes (the max size for a script data object,
3781  // and thus, the maximum size any matched object can have) in a filteradd message
3782  if (vData.size() > MAX_SCRIPT_ELEMENT_SIZE)
3783  {
3784  pfrom->Misbehaving(100);
3785  } else {
3786  LOCK(pfrom->cs_filter);
3787  if (pfrom->pfilter)
3788  pfrom->pfilter->insert(vData);
3789  else
3790  pfrom->Misbehaving(100);
3791  }
3792  }
3793 
3794 
3795  else if (strCommand == "filterclear")
3796  {
3797  LOCK(pfrom->cs_filter);
3798  delete pfrom->pfilter;
3799  pfrom->pfilter = new CBloomFilter();
3800  pfrom->fRelayTxes = true;
3801  }
3802 
3803 
3804  else
3805  {
3806  // Ignore unknown commands for extensibility
3807  }
3808 
3809 
3810  // Update the last seen time for this node's address
3811  if (pfrom->fNetworkNode)
3812  if (strCommand == "version" || strCommand == "addr" || strCommand == "inv" || strCommand == "getdata" || strCommand == "ping")
3813  AddressCurrentlyConnected(pfrom->addr);
3814 
3815 
3816  return true;
3817 }
3818 
3819 // requires LOCK(cs_vRecvMsg)
3820 bool ProcessMessages(CNode* pfrom)
3821 {
3822  //if (fDebug)
3823  // printf("ProcessMessages(%zu messages)\n", pfrom->vRecvMsg.size());
3824 
3825  //
3826  // Message format
3827  // (4) message start
3828  // (12) command
3829  // (4) size
3830  // (4) checksum
3831  // (x) data
3832  //
3833  bool fOk = true;
3834 
3835  if (!pfrom->vRecvGetData.empty())
3836  ProcessGetData(pfrom);
3837 
3838  // this maintains the order of responses
3839  if (!pfrom->vRecvGetData.empty()) return fOk;
3840 
3841  std::deque<CNetMessage>::iterator it = pfrom->vRecvMsg.begin();
3842  while (!pfrom->fDisconnect && it != pfrom->vRecvMsg.end()) {
3843  // Don't bother if send buffer is too full to respond anyway
3844  if (pfrom->nSendSize >= SendBufferSize())
3845  break;
3846 
3847  // get next message
3848  CNetMessage& msg = *it;
3849 
3850  //if (fDebug)
3851  // printf("ProcessMessages(message %u msgsz, %zu bytes, complete:%s)\n",
3852  // msg.hdr.nMessageSize, msg.vRecv.size(),
3853  // msg.complete() ? "Y" : "N");
3854 
3855  // end, if an incomplete message is found
3856  if (!msg.complete())
3857  break;
3858 
3859  // at this point, any failure means we can delete the current message
3860  it++;
3861 
3862  // Scan for message start
3863  if (memcmp(msg.hdr.pchMessageStart, pchMessageStart, sizeof(pchMessageStart)) != 0) {
3864  printf("\n\nPROCESSMESSAGE: INVALID MESSAGESTART\n\n");
3865  fOk = false;
3866  break;
3867  }
3868 
3869  // Read header
3870  CMessageHeader& hdr = msg.hdr;
3871  if (!hdr.IsValid())
3872  {
3873  printf("\n\nPROCESSMESSAGE: ERRORS IN HEADER %s\n\n\n", hdr.GetCommand().c_str());
3874  continue;
3875  }
3876  string strCommand = hdr.GetCommand();
3877 
3878  // Message size
3879  unsigned int nMessageSize = hdr.nMessageSize;
3880 
3881  // Checksum
3882  CDataStream& vRecv = msg.vRecv;
3883  uint256 hash = Hash(vRecv.begin(), vRecv.begin() + nMessageSize);
3884  unsigned int nChecksum = 0;
3885  memcpy(&nChecksum, &hash, sizeof(nChecksum));
3886  if (nChecksum != hdr.nChecksum)
3887  {
3888  printf("ProcessMessages(%s, %u bytes) : CHECKSUM ERROR nChecksum=%08x hdr.nChecksum=%08x\n",
3889  strCommand.c_str(), nMessageSize, nChecksum, hdr.nChecksum);
3890  continue;
3891  }
3892 
3893  // Process message
3894  bool fRet = false;
3895  try
3896  {
3897  {
3898  LOCK(cs_main);
3899  fRet = ProcessMessage(pfrom, strCommand, vRecv);
3900  }
3901  boost::this_thread::interruption_point();
3902  }
3903  catch (std::ios_base::failure& e)
3904  {
3905  if (strstr(e.what(), "end of data"))
3906  {
3907  // Allow exceptions from under-length message on vRecv
3908  printf("ProcessMessages(%s, %u bytes) : Exception '%s' caught, normally caused by a message being shorter than its stated length\n", strCommand.c_str(), nMessageSize, e.what());
3909  }
3910  else if (strstr(e.what(), "size too large"))
3911  {
3912  // Allow exceptions from over-long size
3913  printf("ProcessMessages(%s, %u bytes) : Exception '%s' caught\n", strCommand.c_str(), nMessageSize, e.what());
3914  }
3915  else
3916  {
3917  PrintExceptionContinue(&e, "ProcessMessages()");
3918  }
3919  }
3920  catch (boost::thread_interrupted) {
3921  throw;
3922  }
3923  catch (std::exception& e) {
3924  PrintExceptionContinue(&e, "ProcessMessages()");
3925  } catch (...) {
3926  PrintExceptionContinue(NULL, "ProcessMessages()");
3927  }
3928 
3929  if (!fRet)
3930  printf("ProcessMessage(%s, %u bytes) FAILED\n", strCommand.c_str(), nMessageSize);
3931 
3932  break;
3933  }
3934 
3935  // In case the connection got shut down, its receive buffer was wiped
3936  if (!pfrom->fDisconnect)
3937  pfrom->vRecvMsg.erase(pfrom->vRecvMsg.begin(), it);
3938 
3939  return fOk;
3940 }
3941 
3942 
3943 bool SendMessages(CNode* pto, bool fSendTrickle)
3944 {
3945  TRY_LOCK(cs_main, lockMain);
3946  if (lockMain) {
3947  // Don't send anything until we get their version message
3948  if (pto->nVersion == 0)
3949  return true;
3950 
3951  // Keep-alive ping. We send a nonce of zero because we don't use it anywhere
3952  // right now.
3953  if (pto->nLastSend && GetTime() - pto->nLastSend > 30 * 60 && pto->vSendMsg.empty()) {
3954  uint64 nonce = 0;
3955  if (pto->nVersion > BIP0031_VERSION)
3956  pto->PushMessage("ping", nonce);
3957  else
3958  pto->PushMessage("ping");
3959  }
3960 
3961  // Start block sync
3962  if (pto->fStartSync && !fImporting && !fReindex) {
3963  pto->fStartSync = false;
3964  pto->PushGetBlocks(pindexBest, uint256(0));
3965  }
3966 
3967  // Resend wallet transactions that haven't gotten in a block yet
3968  // Except during reindex, importing and IBD, when old wallet
3969  // transactions become unconfirmed and spams other nodes.
3970  if (!fReindex && !fImporting && !IsInitialBlockDownload())
3971  {
3972  ResendWalletTransactions();
3973  }
3974 
3975  // Address refresh broadcast
3976  static int64 nLastRebroadcast;
3977  if (!IsInitialBlockDownload() && (GetTime() - nLastRebroadcast > 24 * 60 * 60))
3978  {
3979  {
3980  LOCK(cs_vNodes);
3981  BOOST_FOREACH(CNode* pnode, vNodes)
3982  {
3983  // Periodically clear setAddrKnown to allow refresh broadcasts
3984  if (nLastRebroadcast)
3985  pnode->setAddrKnown.clear();
3986 
3987  // Rebroadcast our address
3988  if (!fNoListen)
3989  {
3990  CAddress addr = GetLocalAddress(&pnode->addr);
3991  if (addr.IsRoutable())
3992  pnode->PushAddress(addr);
3993  }
3994  }
3995  }
3996  nLastRebroadcast = GetTime();
3997  }
3998 
3999  //
4000  // Message: addr
4001  //
4002  if (fSendTrickle)
4003  {
4004  vector<CAddress> vAddr;
4005  vAddr.reserve(pto->vAddrToSend.size());
4006  BOOST_FOREACH(const CAddress& addr, pto->vAddrToSend)
4007  {
4008  // returns true if wasn't already contained in the set
4009  if (pto->setAddrKnown.insert(addr).second)
4010  {
4011  vAddr.push_back(addr);
4012  // receiver rejects addr messages larger than 1000
4013  if (vAddr.size() >= 1000)
4014  {
4015  pto->PushMessage("addr", vAddr);
4016  vAddr.clear();
4017  }
4018  }
4019  }
4020  pto->vAddrToSend.clear();
4021  if (!vAddr.empty())
4022  pto->PushMessage("addr", vAddr);
4023  }
4024 
4025 
4026  //
4027  // Message: inventory
4028  //
4029  vector<CInv> vInv;
4030  vector<CInv> vInvWait;
4031  {
4032  LOCK(pto->cs_inventory);
4033  vInv.reserve(pto->vInventoryToSend.size());
4034  vInvWait.reserve(pto->vInventoryToSend.size());
4035  BOOST_FOREACH(const CInv& inv, pto->vInventoryToSend)
4036  {
4037  if (pto->setInventoryKnown.count(inv))
4038  continue;
4039 
4040  // trickle out tx inv to protect privacy
4041  if (inv.type == MSG_TX && !fSendTrickle)
4042  {
4043  // 1/4 of tx invs blast to all immediately
4044  static uint256 hashSalt;
4045  if (hashSalt == 0)
4046  hashSalt = GetRandHash();
4047  uint256 hashRand = inv.hash ^ hashSalt;
4048  hashRand = Hash(BEGIN(hashRand), END(hashRand));
4049  bool fTrickleWait = ((hashRand & 3) != 0);
4050 
4051  // always trickle our own transactions
4052  if (!fTrickleWait)
4053  {
4054  CWalletTx wtx;
4055  if (GetTransaction(inv.hash, wtx))
4056  if (wtx.fFromMe)
4057  fTrickleWait = true;
4058  }
4059 
4060  if (fTrickleWait)
4061  {
4062  vInvWait.push_back(inv);
4063  continue;
4064  }
4065  }
4066 
4067  // returns true if wasn't already contained in the set
4068  if (pto->setInventoryKnown.insert(inv).second)
4069  {
4070  vInv.push_back(inv);
4071  if (vInv.size() >= 1000)
4072  {
4073  pto->PushMessage("inv", vInv);
4074  vInv.clear();
4075  }
4076  }
4077  }
4078  pto->vInventoryToSend = vInvWait;
4079  }
4080  if (!vInv.empty())
4081  pto->PushMessage("inv", vInv);
4082 
4083 
4084  //
4085  // Message: getdata
4086  //
4087  vector<CInv> vGetData;
4088  int64 nNow = GetTime() * 1000000;
4089  while (!pto->mapAskFor.empty() && (*pto->mapAskFor.begin()).first <= nNow)
4090  {
4091  const CInv& inv = (*pto->mapAskFor.begin()).second;
4092  if (!AlreadyHave(inv))
4093  {
4094  if (fDebugNet)
4095  printf("sending getdata: %s\n", inv.ToString().c_str());
4096  vGetData.push_back(inv);
4097  if (vGetData.size() >= 1000)
4098  {
4099  pto->PushMessage("getdata", vGetData);
4100  vGetData.clear();
4101  }
4102  }
4103  pto->mapAskFor.erase(pto->mapAskFor.begin());
4104  }
4105  if (!vGetData.empty())
4106  pto->PushMessage("getdata", vGetData);
4107 
4108  }
4109  return true;
4110 }

4130 int static FormatHashBlocks(void* pbuffer, unsigned int len)
4131 {
4132  unsigned char* pdata = (unsigned char*)pbuffer;
4133  unsigned int blocks = 1 + ((len + 8) / 64);
4134  unsigned char* pend = pdata + 64 * blocks;
4135  memset(pdata + len, 0, 64 * blocks - len);
4136  pdata[len] = 0x80;
4137  unsigned int bits = len * 8;
4138  pend[-1] = (bits >> 0) & 0xff;
4139  pend[-2] = (bits >> 8) & 0xff;
4140  pend[-3] = (bits >> 16) & 0xff;
4141  pend[-4] = (bits >> 24) & 0xff;
4142  return blocks;
4143 }

4145 static const unsigned int pSHA256InitState[8] =
4146 {0x6a09e667, 0xbb67ae85, 0x3c6ef372, 0xa54ff53a, 0x510e527f, 0x9b05688c, 0x1f83d9ab, 0x5be0cd19};
4147 
4148 void SHA256Transform(void* pstate, void* pinput, const void* pinit)
4149 {
4150  SHA256_CTX ctx;
4151  unsigned char data[64];
4152 
4153  SHA256_Init(&ctx);
4154 
4155  for (int i = 0; i < 16; i++)
4156  ((uint32_t*)data)[i] = ByteReverse(((uint32_t*)pinput)[i]);
4157 
4158  for (int i = 0; i < 8; i++)
4159  ctx.h[i] = ((uint32_t*)pinit)[i];
4160 
4161  SHA256_Update(&ctx, data, sizeof(data));
4162  for (int i = 0; i < 8; i++)
4163  ((uint32_t*)pstate)[i] = ctx.h[i];
4164 }

4194 // We want to sort transactions by priority and fee, so:
4195 typedef boost::tuple<double, double, CTransaction*> TxPriority;
4196 class TxPriorityCompare
4197 {
4198  bool byFee;
4199 public:
4200  TxPriorityCompare(bool _byFee) : byFee(_byFee) { }
4201  bool operator()(const TxPriority& a, const TxPriority& b)
4202  {
4203  if (byFee)
4204  {
4205  if (a.get<1>() == b.get<1>())
4206  return a.get<0>() < b.get<0>();
4207  return a.get<1>() < b.get<1>();
4208  }
4209  else
4210  {
4211  if (a.get<0>() == b.get<0>())
4212  return a.get<1>() < b.get<1>();
4213  return a.get<0>() < b.get<0>();
4214  }
4215  }
4216 };

4218 CBlockTemplate* CreateNewBlock(const CScript& scriptPubKeyIn)
4219 {
4220  // Create new block
4221  auto_ptr<CBlockTemplate> pblocktemplate(new CBlockTemplate());
4222  if(!pblocktemplate.get())
4223  return NULL;
4224  CBlock *pblock = &pblocktemplate->block; // pointer for convenience
4225 
4226  // Create coinbase tx
4227  CTransaction txNew;
4228  txNew.vin.resize(1);
4229  txNew.vin[0].prevout.SetNull();
4230  txNew.vout.resize(1);
4231  txNew.vout[0].scriptPubKey = scriptPubKeyIn;
4232 
4233  // Add our coinbase tx as first transaction
4234  pblock->vtx.push_back(txNew);
4235  pblocktemplate->vTxFees.push_back(-1); // updated at end
4236  pblocktemplate->vTxSigOps.push_back(-1); // updated at end
4237 
4238  // Largest block you're willing to create:
4239  unsigned int nBlockMaxSize = GetArg("-blockmaxsize", DEFAULT_BLOCK_MAX_SIZE);
4240  // Limit to betweeen 1K and MAX_BLOCK_SIZE-1K for sanity:
4241  nBlockMaxSize = std::max((unsigned int)1000, std::min((unsigned int)(MAX_BLOCK_SIZE-1000), nBlockMaxSize));
4242 
4243  // How much of the block should be dedicated to high-priority transactions,
4244  // included regardless of the fees they pay
4245  unsigned int nBlockPrioritySize = GetArg("-blockprioritysize", DEFAULT_BLOCK_PRIORITY_SIZE);
4246  nBlockPrioritySize = std::min(nBlockMaxSize, nBlockPrioritySize);
4247 
4248  // Minimum block size you want to create; block will be filled with free transactions
4249  // until there are no more or the block reaches this size:
4250  unsigned int nBlockMinSize = GetArg("-blockminsize", 0);
4251  nBlockMinSize = std::min(nBlockMaxSize, nBlockMinSize);
4252 
4253  // Collect memory pool transactions into the block
4254  int64 nFees = 0;
4255  {
4256  LOCK2(cs_main, mempool.cs);
4257  CBlockIndex* pindexPrev = pindexBest;
4258  CCoinsViewCache view(*pcoinsTip, true);
4259 
4260  // Priority order to process transactions
4261  list<COrphan> vOrphan; // list memory doesn't move
4262  map<uint256, vector<COrphan*> > mapDependers;
4263  bool fPrintPriority = GetBoolArg("-printpriority");
4264 
4265  // This vector will be sorted into a priority queue:
4266  vector<TxPriority> vecPriority;
4267  vecPriority.reserve(mempool.mapTx.size());
4268  for (map<uint256, CTransaction>::iterator mi = mempool.mapTx.begin(); mi != mempool.mapTx.end(); ++mi)
4269  {
4270  CTransaction& tx = (*mi).second;
4271  if (tx.IsCoinBase() || !tx.IsFinal())
4272  continue;
4273 
4274  COrphan* porphan = NULL;
4275  double dPriority = 0;
4276  int64 nTotalIn = 0;
4277  bool fMissingInputs = false;
4278  BOOST_FOREACH(const CTxIn& txin, tx.vin)
4279  {
4280  // Read prev transaction
4281  if (!view.HaveCoins(txin.prevout.hash))
4282  {
4283  // This should never happen; all transactions in the memory
4284  // pool should connect to either transactions in the chain
4285  // or other transactions in the memory pool.
4286  if (!mempool.mapTx.count(txin.prevout.hash))
4287  {
4288  printf("ERROR: mempool transaction missing input\n");
4289  if (fDebug) assert("mempool transaction missing input" == 0);
4290  fMissingInputs = true;
4291  if (porphan)
4292  vOrphan.pop_back();
4293  break;
4294  }
4295 
4296  // Has to wait for dependencies
4297  if (!porphan)
4298  {
4299  // Use list for automatic deletion
4300  vOrphan.push_back(COrphan(&tx));
4301  porphan = &vOrphan.back();
4302  }
4303  mapDependers[txin.prevout.hash].push_back(porphan);
4304  porphan->setDependsOn.insert(txin.prevout.hash);
4305  nTotalIn += mempool.mapTx[txin.prevout.hash].vout[txin.prevout.n].nValue;
4306  continue;
4307  }
4308  const CCoins &coins = view.GetCoins(txin.prevout.hash);
4309 
4310  int64 nValueIn = coins.vout[txin.prevout.n].nValue;
4311  nTotalIn += nValueIn;
4312 
4313  int nConf = pindexPrev->nHeight - coins.nHeight + 1;
4314 
4315  dPriority += (double)nValueIn * nConf;
4316  }
4317  if (fMissingInputs) continue;
4318 
4319  // Priority is sum(valuein * age) / txsize
4320  unsigned int nTxSize = ::GetSerializeSize(tx, SER_NETWORK, PROTOCOL_VERSION);
4321  dPriority /= nTxSize;
4322 
4323  // This is a more accurate fee-per-kilobyte than is used by the client code, because the
4324  // client code rounds up the size to the nearest 1K. That's good, because it gives an
4325  // incentive to create smaller transactions.
4326  double dFeePerKb = double(nTotalIn-tx.GetValueOut()) / (double(nTxSize)/1000.0);
4327 
4328  if (porphan)
4329  {
4330  porphan->dPriority = dPriority;
4331  porphan->dFeePerKb = dFeePerKb;
4332  }
4333  else
4334  vecPriority.push_back(TxPriority(dPriority, dFeePerKb, &(*mi).second));
4335  }
4336 
4337  // Collect transactions into block
4338  uint64 nBlockSize = 1000;
4339  uint64 nBlockTx = 0;
4340  int nBlockSigOps = 100;
4341  bool fSortedByFee = (nBlockPrioritySize <= 0);
4342 
4343  TxPriorityCompare comparer(fSortedByFee);
4344  std::make_heap(vecPriority.begin(), vecPriority.end(), comparer);
4345 
4346  while (!vecPriority.empty())
4347  {
4348  // Take highest priority transaction off the priority queue:
4349  double dPriority = vecPriority.front().get<0>();
4350  double dFeePerKb = vecPriority.front().get<1>();
4351  CTransaction& tx = *(vecPriority.front().get<2>());
4352 
4353  std::pop_heap(vecPriority.begin(), vecPriority.end(), comparer);
4354  vecPriority.pop_back();
4355 
4356  // Size limits
4357  unsigned int nTxSize = ::GetSerializeSize(tx, SER_NETWORK, PROTOCOL_VERSION);
4358  if (nBlockSize + nTxSize >= nBlockMaxSize)
4359  continue;
4360 
4361  // Legacy limits on sigOps:
4362  unsigned int nTxSigOps = tx.GetLegacySigOpCount();
4363  if (nBlockSigOps + nTxSigOps >= MAX_BLOCK_SIGOPS)
4364  continue;
4365 
4366  // Skip free transactions if we're past the minimum block size:
4367  if (fSortedByFee && (dFeePerKb < CTransaction::nMinTxFee) && (nBlockSize + nTxSize >= nBlockMinSize))
4368  continue;
4369 
4370  // Prioritize by fee once past the priority size or we run out of high-priority
4371  // transactions:
4372  if (!fSortedByFee &&
4373  ((nBlockSize + nTxSize >= nBlockPrioritySize) || (dPriority < COIN * 576 / 250)))
4374  {
4375  fSortedByFee = true;
4376  comparer = TxPriorityCompare(fSortedByFee);
4377  std::make_heap(vecPriority.begin(), vecPriority.end(), comparer);
4378  }
4379 
4380  if (!tx.HaveInputs(view))
4381  continue;
4382 
4383  int64 nTxFees = tx.GetValueIn(view)-tx.GetValueOut();
4384 
4385  nTxSigOps += tx.GetP2SHSigOpCount(view);
4386  if (nBlockSigOps + nTxSigOps >= MAX_BLOCK_SIGOPS)
4387  continue;
4388 
4389  CValidationState state;
4390  if (!tx.CheckInputs(state, view, true, SCRIPT_VERIFY_P2SH))
4391  continue;
4392 
4393  CTxUndo txundo;
4394  uint256 hash = tx.GetHash();
4395  tx.UpdateCoins(state, view, txundo, pindexPrev->nHeight+1, hash);
4396 
4397  // Added
4398  pblock->vtx.push_back(tx);
4399  pblocktemplate->vTxFees.push_back(nTxFees);
4400  pblocktemplate->vTxSigOps.push_back(nTxSigOps);
4401  nBlockSize += nTxSize;
4402  ++nBlockTx;
4403  nBlockSigOps += nTxSigOps;
4404  nFees += nTxFees;
4405 
4406  if (fPrintPriority)
4407  {
4408  printf("priority %.1f feeperkb %.1f txid %s\n",
4409  dPriority, dFeePerKb, tx.GetHash().ToString().c_str());
4410  }
4411 
4412  // Add transactions that depend on this one to the priority queue
4413  if (mapDependers.count(hash))
4414  {
4415  BOOST_FOREACH(COrphan* porphan, mapDependers[hash])
4416  {
4417  if (!porphan->setDependsOn.empty())
4418  {
4419  porphan->setDependsOn.erase(hash);
4420  if (porphan->setDependsOn.empty())
4421  {
4422  vecPriority.push_back(TxPriority(porphan->dPriority, porphan->dFeePerKb, porphan->ptx));
4423  std::push_heap(vecPriority.begin(), vecPriority.end(), comparer);
4424  }
4425  }
4426  }
4427  }
4428  }
4429 
4430  nLastBlockTx = nBlockTx;
4431  nLastBlockSize = nBlockSize;
4432  printf("CreateNewBlock(): total size %"PRI64u"\n", nBlockSize);
4433 
4434  pblock->vtx[0].vout[0].nValue = GetBlockValue(pindexPrev->nHeight+1, nFees);
4435  pblocktemplate->vTxFees[0] = -nFees;
4436 
4437  // Fill in header
4438  pblock->hashPrevBlock = pindexPrev->GetBlockHash();
4439  pblock->UpdateTime(pindexPrev);
4440  pblock->nBits = GetNextWorkRequired(pindexPrev, pblock);
4441  pblock->nNonce = 0;
4442  pblock->vtx[0].vin[0].scriptSig = CScript() << OP_0 << OP_0;
4443  pblocktemplate->vTxSigOps[0] = pblock->vtx[0].GetLegacySigOpCount();
4444 
4445  CBlockIndex indexDummy(*pblock);
4446  indexDummy.pprev = pindexPrev;
4447  indexDummy.nHeight = pindexPrev->nHeight + 1;
4448  CCoinsViewCache viewNew(*pcoinsTip, true);
4449  CValidationState state;
4450  if (!pblock->ConnectBlock(state, &indexDummy, viewNew, true))
4451  throw std::runtime_error("CreateNewBlock() : ConnectBlock failed");
4452  }
4453 
4454  return pblocktemplate.release();
4455 }

4467 void IncrementExtraNonce(CBlock* pblock, CBlockIndex* pindexPrev, unsigned int& nExtraNonce)
4468 {
4469  // Update nExtraNonce
4470  static uint256 hashPrevBlock;
4471  if (hashPrevBlock != pblock->hashPrevBlock)
4472  {
4473  nExtraNonce = 0;
4474  hashPrevBlock = pblock->hashPrevBlock;
4475  }
4476  ++nExtraNonce;
4477  unsigned int nHeight = pindexPrev->nHeight+1; // Height first in coinbase required for block.version=2
4478  pblock->vtx[0].vin[0].scriptSig = (CScript() << nHeight << CBigNum(nExtraNonce)) + COINBASE_FLAGS;
4479  assert(pblock->vtx[0].vin[0].scriptSig.size() <= 100);
4480 
4481  pblock->hashMerkleRoot = pblock->BuildMerkleTree();
4482 }

4485 void FormatHashBuffers(CBlock* pblock, char* pmidstate, char* pdata, char* phash1)
4486 {
4487  //
4488  // Pre-build hash buffers
4489  //
4490  struct
4491  {
4492  struct unnamed2
4493  {
4494  int nVersion;
4495  uint256 hashPrevBlock;
4496  uint256 hashMerkleRoot;
4497  unsigned int nTime;
4498  unsigned int nBits;
4499  unsigned int nNonce;
4500  }
4501  block;
4502  unsigned char pchPadding0[64];
4503  uint256 hash1;
4504  unsigned char pchPadding1[64];
4505  }
4506  tmp;
4507  memset(&tmp, 0, sizeof(tmp));
4508 
4509  tmp.block.nVersion = pblock->nVersion;
4510  tmp.block.hashPrevBlock = pblock->hashPrevBlock;
4511  tmp.block.hashMerkleRoot = pblock->hashMerkleRoot;
4512  tmp.block.nTime = pblock->nTime;
4513  tmp.block.nBits = pblock->nBits;
4514  tmp.block.nNonce = pblock->nNonce;
4515 
4516  FormatHashBlocks(&tmp.block, sizeof(tmp.block));
4517  FormatHashBlocks(&tmp.hash1, sizeof(tmp.hash1));
4518 
4519  // Byte swap all the input buffer
4520  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < sizeof(tmp)/4; i++)
4521  ((unsigned int*)&tmp)[i] = ByteReverse(((unsigned int*)&tmp)[i]);
4522 
4523  // Precalc the first half of the first hash, which stays constant
4524  SHA256Transform(pmidstate, &tmp.block, pSHA256InitState);
4525 
4526  memcpy(pdata, &tmp.block, 128);
4527  memcpy(phash1, &tmp.hash1, 64);
4528 }

4531 bool CheckWork(CBlock* pblock, CWallet& wallet, CReserveKey& reservekey)
4532 {
4533  uint256 hash = pblock->GetPoWHash();
4534  uint256 hashTarget = CBigNum().SetCompact(pblock->nBits).getuint256();
4535 
4536  if (hash > hashTarget)
4537  return false;
4538 
4540  printf("CzarcoinMiner:\n");
4541  printf("proof-of-work found \n hash: %s \ntarget: %s\n", hash.GetHex().c_str(), hashTarget.GetHex().c_str());
4542  pblock->print();
4543  printf("generated %s\n", FormatMoney(pblock->vtx[0].vout[0].nValue).c_str());
4544 
4545  // Found a solution
4546  {
4547  LOCK(cs_main);
4548  if (pblock->hashPrevBlock != hashBestChain)
4549  return error("CzarcoinMiner : generated block is stale");
4550 
4551  // Remove key from key pool
4552  reservekey.KeepKey();
4553 
4554  // Track how many getdata requests this block gets
4555  {
4556  LOCK(wallet.cs_wallet);
4557  wallet.mapRequestCount[pblock->GetHash()] = 0;
4558  }
4559 
4560  // Process this block the same as if we had received it from another node
4561  CValidationState state;
4562  if (!ProcessBlock(state, NULL, pblock))
4563  return error("CzarcoinMiner : ProcessBlock, block not accepted");
4564  }
4565 
4566  return true;
4567 }

4569 void static CzarcoinMiner(CWallet *pwallet)
4570 {
4571  printf("CzarcoinMiner started\n");
4572  SetThreadPriority(THREAD_PRIORITY_LOWEST);
4573  RenameThread("czarcoin-miner");
4574 
4575  // Each thread has its own key and counter
4576  CReserveKey reservekey(pwallet);
4577  unsigned int nExtraNonce = 0;
4578 
4579  try { loop {
4580  while (vNodes.empty())
4581  MilliSleep(1000);
4582 
4583  //
4584  // Create new block
4585  //
4586  unsigned int nTransactionsUpdatedLast = nTransactionsUpdated;
4587  CBlockIndex* pindexPrev = pindexBest;
4588 
4589  auto_ptr<CBlockTemplate> pblocktemplate(CreateNewBlockWithKey(reservekey));
4590  if (!pblocktemplate.get())
4591  return;
4592  CBlock *pblock = &pblocktemplate->block;
4593  IncrementExtraNonce(pblock, pindexPrev, nExtraNonce);
4594 
4595  printf("Running CzarcoinMiner with %"PRIszu" transactions in block (%u bytes)\n", pblock->vtx.size(),
4596  ::GetSerializeSize(*pblock, SER_NETWORK, PROTOCOL_VERSION));
4597 
4598  //
4599  // Pre-build hash buffers
4600  //
4601  char pmidstatebuf[32+16]; char* pmidstate = alignup<16>(pmidstatebuf);
4602  char pdatabuf[128+16]; char* pdata = alignup<16>(pdatabuf);
4603  char phash1buf[64+16]; char* phash1 = alignup<16>(phash1buf);
4604 
4605  FormatHashBuffers(pblock, pmidstate, pdata, phash1);
4606 
4607  unsigned int& nBlockTime = *(unsigned int*)(pdata + 64 + 4);
4608  unsigned int& nBlockBits = *(unsigned int*)(pdata + 64 + 8);
4609  //unsigned int& nBlockNonce = *(unsigned int*)(pdata + 64 + 12);
4610 
4611 
4612  //
4613  // Search
4614  //
4615  int64 nStart = GetTime();
4616  uint256 hashTarget = CBigNum().SetCompact(pblock->nBits).getuint256();
4617  loop
4618  {
4619  unsigned int nHashesDone = 0;
4620 
4621  uint256 thash;
4622  char scratchpad[SCRYPT_SCRATCHPAD_SIZE];
4623  loop
4624  {
4625  scrypt_1024_1_1_256_sp(BEGIN(pblock->nVersion), BEGIN(thash), scratchpad);
4626 
4627  if (thash <= hashTarget)
4628  {
4629  // Found a solution
4630  SetThreadPriority(THREAD_PRIORITY_NORMAL);
4631  CheckWork(pblock, *pwallet, reservekey);
4632  SetThreadPriority(THREAD_PRIORITY_LOWEST);
4633  break;
4634  }
4635  pblock->nNonce += 1;
4636  nHashesDone += 1;
4637  if ((pblock->nNonce & 0xFF) == 0)
4638  break;
4639  }
4640 
4641  // Meter hashes/sec
4642  static int64 nHashCounter;
4643  if (nHPSTimerStart == 0)
4644  {
4645  nHPSTimerStart = GetTimeMillis();
4646  nHashCounter = 0;
4647  }
4648  else
4649  nHashCounter += nHashesDone;
4650  if (GetTimeMillis() - nHPSTimerStart > 4000)
4651  {
4652  static CCriticalSection cs;
4653  {
4654  LOCK(cs);
4655  if (GetTimeMillis() - nHPSTimerStart > 4000)
4656  {
4657  dHashesPerSec = 1000.0 * nHashCounter / (GetTimeMillis() - nHPSTimerStart);
4658  nHPSTimerStart = GetTimeMillis();
4659  nHashCounter = 0;
4660  static int64 nLogTime;
4661  if (GetTime() - nLogTime > 30 * 60)
4662  {
4663  nLogTime = GetTime();
4664  printf("hashmeter %6.0f khash/s\n", dHashesPerSec/1000.0);
4665  }
4666  }
4667  }
4668  }
4669 
4670  // Check for stop or if block needs to be rebuilt
4671  boost::this_thread::interruption_point();
4672  if (vNodes.empty())
4673  break;
4674  if (pblock->nNonce >= 0xffff0000)
4675  break;
4676  if (nTransactionsUpdated != nTransactionsUpdatedLast && GetTime() - nStart > 60)
4677  break;
4678  if (pindexPrev != pindexBest)
4679  break;
4680 
4681  // Update nTime every few seconds
4682  pblock->UpdateTime(pindexPrev);
4683  nBlockTime = ByteReverse(pblock->nTime);
4684  if (fTestNet)
4685  {
4686  // Changing pblock->nTime can change work required on testnet:
4687  nBlockBits = ByteReverse(pblock->nBits);
4688  hashTarget = CBigNum().SetCompact(pblock->nBits).getuint256();
4689  }
4690  }
4691  } }
4692  catch (boost::thread_interrupted)
4693  {
4694  printf("CzarcoinMiner terminated\n");
4695  throw;
4696  }
4697 }

4721 
4722 // Amount compression:
4723 // * If the amount is 0, output 0
4724 // * first, divide the amount (in base units) by the largest power of 10 possible; call the exponent e (e is max 9)
4725 // * if e<9, the last digit of the resulting number cannot be 0; store it as d, and drop it (divide by 10)
4726 // * call the result n
4727 // * output 1 + 10*(9*n + d - 1) + e
4728 // * if e==9, we only know the resulting number is not zero, so output 1 + 10*(n - 1) + 9
4729 // (this is decodable, as d is in [1-9] and e is in [0-9])
4730 
4731 uint64 CTxOutCompressor::CompressAmount(uint64 n)
4732 {
4733  if (n == 0)
4734  return 0;
4735  int e = 0;
4736  while (((n % 10) == 0) && e < 9) {
4737  n /= 10;
4738  e++;
4739  }
4740  if (e < 9) {
4741  int d = (n % 10);
4742  assert(d >= 1 && d <= 9);
4743  n /= 10;
4744  return 1 + (n*9 + d - 1)*10 + e;
4745  } else {
4746  return 1 + (n - 1)*10 + 9;
4747  }
4748 }
4749 
4750 uint64 CTxOutCompressor::DecompressAmount(uint64 x)
4751 {
4752  // x = 0 OR x = 1+10*(9*n + d - 1) + e OR x = 1+10*(n - 1) + 9
4753  if (x == 0)
4754  return 0;
4755  x--;
4756  // x = 10*(9*n + d - 1) + e
4757  int e = x % 10;
4758  x /= 10;
4759  uint64 n = 0;
4760  if (e < 9) {
4761  // x = 9*n + d - 1
4762  int d = (x % 9) + 1;
4763  x /= 9;
4764  // x = n
4765  n = x*10 + d;
4766  } else {
4767  n = x+1;
4768  }
4769  while (e) {
4770  n *= 10;
4771  e--;
4772  }
4773  return n;
4774 }
